You can also take a boat ride on Lake Geneva, or take a stroll through the city's parks and gardens. Evening: Spend the evening in Geneva's vibrant nightlife. Here, you can find a variety of bars, pubs and clubs, as well as restaurants offering a variety of international cuisines. End the Day with: For dinner, try the local speciality, fondue, at the popular restaurant, La Fondue.

Day 1 Morning: Mysore is known as the cultural capital of Karnataka and is one of the most popular tourist destinations in India. Start your day by visiting Mysore Palace, one of the most beautiful and well-preserved palaces in India. Take a tour of the palace and explore its grandeur and intricate architecture. After that, take a walk through the beautiful Brindavan Gardens, located near the dam. Here you can enjoy the beauty of nature and explore the different varieties of flowers and fountains. Afternoon: After lunch, head to the famous Mysore Zoo, one of the oldest and largest zoos in India. Here you can explore the various species of animals and birds. You can also take a safari ride to get a closer look at the animals. After that, visit the Chamundi Hills, which is home to the famous Chamundeshwari Temple. Here you can take in the stunning views of the city and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. Evening: In the evening, explore the vibrant markets of Mysore. Here you can find a wide variety of traditional items like silk sarees, handicrafts, jewellery and much more. You can also enjoy the delicious street food here. End the day with a visit to the popular restaurant, 'Hotel RRR', which serves traditional Mysore cuisine. Day 2 Morning: Start your day by visiting the famous Mysore Sand Sculpture Museum, which features the world's largest collection of sand sculptures. Here you can admire the beautiful sculptures and learn about the history and culture of Mysore. After that, take a stroll through the beautiful Lalitha Mahal Palace, which is one of the grandest palaces in India. Here you can explore the stunning architecture and take in the breathtaking views of the city. Afternoon: After lunch, head to the famous Mysore Palace of Lights, which is illuminated with over 100,000 lights in the evening. Day 1 Morning: Start the day with a visit to the Colosseum, one of Rome's most iconic landmarks. Here, tourists can marvel at the grandeur of the ancient amphitheater, as well as learn about its history and the events that took place here. Afternoon: After lunch, head to the Pantheon, a magnificent temple dedicated to all the gods of Ancient Rome. Here, tourists can admire the stunning architecture and learn more about the history of the building. Evening: Spend the evening exploring the narrow streets of Rome's Trastevere neighborhood. Here, tourists can enjoy the lively atmosphere and sample some of the delicious local cuisine. End the day with dinner at La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali, a popular eatery serving traditional Roman dishes. Day 2 Morning: Begin the day with a visit to the Trevi Fountain, one of Rome's most famous landmarks. Here, tourists can marvel at the beauty of the fountain and throw a coin into the water for good luck. Afternoon: After lunch, head to the Spanish Steps, a beautiful staircase lined with shops and cafes. Here, tourists can take in the stunning views of the city and enjoy some of the local culture. Evening: Spend the evening exploring the ancient ruins of the Roman Forum. Here, tourists can learn about the history of the city and see some of the ancient monuments. End the day with dinner at Osteria da Fortunata, a popular eatery serving traditional Roman dishes.

Day 1 Morning: Visit the Colosseum, one of the most iconic monuments in Rome. It was built in the first century AD and is a must-see for any tourist. Take in the sights of the city while listening to the sounds of the river. End the day with dinner at La Pergola, a Michelin-starred restaurant with stunning views of the city. Evening: Enjoy a leisurely stroll through Trastevere, the city’s most picturesque neighborhood. Visit the local bars and restaurants, and take in the lively atmosphere. End the day with dinner at Da Enzo al 29, a popular trattoria serving traditional Roman dishes. Evening: Take a stroll through the Spanish Steps, a famous staircase in the heart of Rome. Admire the views of the city and enjoy the lively atmosphere. End the day with dinner at Antica Pesa, a popular restaurant serving traditional Roman cuisine.

Day 1: Morning: Jaisalmer is a city in the Indian state of Rajasthan, famous for its golden sandstone architecture and stunning desert scenery. Start your day by exploring the Jaisalmer Fort, a stunning sandstone structure that stands atop a hill in the city. You can also visit the nearby Havelis, a collection of intricately carved mansions built by wealthy merchants. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the desert landscape around Jaisalmer. You can take a camel safari through the sand dunes, visit the nearby Kuldhara village, or take a jeep safari to explore the desert. Evening: For the evening, take a stroll through the narrow streets of the old city, and explore the many shops, restaurants, and cafes. You can also visit the Patwaon ki Haveli, a stunning haveli that is home to a museum and art gallery. End the day with dinner at the famous Nathmalji ki Haveli, a restaurant that serves traditional Rajasthani cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Gadisar Lake, a man-made lake that was built in the 14th century. Here you can take a boat ride, or simply admire the lake's stunning views. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the nearby Sam Sand Dunes, a stunning desert landscape that is home to many species of birds and wildlife. You can also take a jeep safari through the dunes and explore the local villages. Evening: For the evening, take a stroll through the city's vibrant markets, where you can buy local handicrafts, jewelry, and spices. End the day with dinner at the Jaisalmer Bhojanalaya, a restaurant that serves traditional Rajasthani food.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by exploring the Jaisalmer Fort, one of the largest and oldest forts in Rajasthan. Built in 1156 AD, it is a living fort with many people living within its walls. Take a guided tour to get the most out of your visit and admire its architecture and stunning views of the city. Afternoon: After lunch, explore the vibrant streets of Jaisalmer and enjoy the bustling bazaars and the old havelis. Visit the Patwaon ki Haveli, the Salim Singh ki Haveli and the Nathmalji ki Haveli. Take in the stunning architecture and the intricate carvings of these havelis. Evening: Head to the Gadisar Lake in the evening for a relaxing boat ride. Enjoy the beauty of the lake and the surrounding temples and shrines. After the boat ride, end the day with dinner at the famous Rajmahal restaurant, which serves traditional Rajasthani cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Start your day by visiting the Jaisalmer War Museum, which is devoted to the history of the Indian Armed Forces. It is a great place to learn about the history of the Indian military and its role in the various wars. Afternoon: In the afternoon, explore the nearby Thar Desert and enjoy a camel safari. Enjoy the beauty of the desert and the stunning views of the sand dunes. Later, take a break and enjoy some delicious Rajasthani snacks at the local food stalls. Evening: In the evening, visit the Sam Sand Dunes and enjoy the stunning views of the sunset. End the day with dinner at the famous Laxmi Niwas Palace, which serves traditional Rajasthani cuisine. Day 3: Morning: Start your day by visiting the Bada Bagh, a complex of cenotaphs and memorials. Take a guided tour of the complex and admire the stunning architecture and the intricate carvings. Afternoon: In the afternoon, visit the Jain Temples of Lodurva, which are a group of temples dedicated to the Jain religion. Admire the stunning architecture and the intricate carvings of these temples. Evening: In the evening, visit the famous Desert Cultural Centre and enjoy a traditional Rajasthani folk performance. End the day with dinner at the famous Bhati Restaurant, which serves traditional Rajasthani cuisine.

Day 1: Morning: Visit Jaisalmer Fort, also known as the Golden Fort. This is one of the oldest forts in India and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Take a guided tour of the fort and explore its many monuments and palaces. Afternoon: Visit the Salim Singh-ki-Haveli and Nathmal-ki-Haveli. Both are beautiful and intricately carved havelis. Day 1: Morning: Varkala is a beautiful coastal town in Kerala, India. It is known for its serene beaches, unique cliff formations, and ancient Hindu temples. Start your day with a visit to the famous Janardhana Swami Temple, a 2000-year-old temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. After that, take a stroll along the Varkala beach, a stunning beach with white sand and blue waters. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the nearby attractions, such as the Sivagiri Mutt, a spiritual centre founded by the social reformer Sree Narayana Guru. You can also visit the Anjengo Fort, a 17th-century fort built by the British East India Company. Evening: In the evening, take a boat ride to explore the nearby Kappil beach, a stunning beach with lush green palms and a picturesque lighthouse. You can also take a dip in the nearby mineral springs, believed to have healing powers. End the day with dinner at the Clafouti, a popular restaurant that serves delicious seafood and local delicacies. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Varkala Tunnel, an engineering marvel built by the British in the 19th century. After that, take a walk along the Varkala Cliff, a stunning cliff that offers breathtaking views of the Arabian Sea. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the nearby attractions, such as the Edava Beach, a secluded beach with crystal clear waters and white sands. You can also visit the Varkala Aquarium, which houses a variety of aquatic species. Evening: In the evening, take a stroll along the Varkala Market, a bustling market that sells a variety of local items. You can also visit the Kappil Lake, a tranquil lake surrounded by lush greenery. End the day with dinner at the Sreepadman, a popular restaurant that serves delicious Keralan cuisine.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Nalanda Archaeological Museum. It houses a collection of ancient Buddhist and Hindu sculptures, coins, inscriptions, and other artifacts from the area. Afternoon: Head to the ruins of the ancient Nalanda University. This is one of the oldest universities in the world and is a World Heritage Site. Explore the ruins and learn about the history of the university. Evening: Visit the Nalanda Stupa, an ancient Buddhist monument. It is said to have been built by the Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE. Enjoy the beautiful sunset views from here. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Chhotiwala. Sample some of the delicious local cuisine and enjoy the warm hospitality. Afternoon: Explore the Nalanda Archaeological Park, which is home to several ancient structures, including temples and monasteries. Evening: Visit the nearby Rajgir Hot Springs, which are believed to have healing properties. Soak in the hot springs and relax. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Bhoj. Enjoy some of the delicious local dishes and enjoy a pleasant evening.

Day 1: Morning: Sanchi is an ancient Buddhist complex located in the state of Madhya Pradesh, India. Day 1: Morning: Kurukshetra is a city in the Indian state of Haryana, situated at the banks of the holy river Saraswati. End the day with dinner at the famous Parikrama restaurant, which offers delicious local cuisine. Afternoon: Visit some of the famous temples in the city, like the Bhadrakali Temple, the Sri Krishna Museum, and the Kurukshetra Panorama and Science Centre. You can also visit the Sannihit Sarovar, one of the five sacred lakes in India. Evening: Explore the markets of Kurukshetra and buy some souvenirs. Enjoy a traditional Haryanvi dinner at the local eateries. End the day with a visit to the local food joint, 'Kanha Sweets', for some delicious sweets. Day 2: Morning: Visit the Bhishma Kund, a sacred pond, and the Sthaneshwar Mahadev Temple. You can also visit the ancient ruins of Kalayat, an ancient town dating back to the Mahabharata era. Afternoon: Take a boat ride on the sacred Saraswati River. Visit the famous Sheeghra Dham temple and the Thanesar+Sahib" target="_blank" >Gurudwara Shri Thanesar Sahib. Evening: Take a stroll in the local bazaars and shop for some traditional handicrafts. End the day with dinner at 'Delhi Darbar', a popular restaurant serving traditional North Indian cuisine. Day 3: Morning: Visit the ancient Mahabharata sites like the battlefield of Kurukshetra and the Bhishma Kund. Afternoon: Visit the Sannihit Sarovar and take a holy dip in the sacred waters. Visit the nearby town of Thanesar, the birthplace of Guru Nanak, the founder of Sikhism. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Haryanvi dinner at the local eateries. End the day with dinner at 'Jal Mahal', a popular restaurant serving North Indian cuisine. Day 4: Morning: Visit the famous Jyotisar, the place where Lord Krishna delivered the Bhagavad Gita. Afternoon: Visit the famous temples in the city, like the Bhadrakali Temple, the Sri Krishna Museum, and the Kurukshetra Panorama and Science Centre. Evening: Take a stroll in the local bazaars and shop for some traditional handicrafts. End the day with dinner at 'Gulati', a popular restaurant serving authentic North Indian cuisine.

Day 1: Morning: Start the day by visiting the holy city of Kurukshetra. Visit the Bhadrakali Temple, which is dedicated to the goddess Kali, and the Jyotisar, which is the site of the Battle of Kurukshetra. Afternoon: Visit the Kurukshetra Panorama and Science Centre, which offers a multimedia presentation of the Mahabharata, and the Brahma Sarovar, which is a holy lake. Evening: Visit the Sannihit Sarovar, which is said to be the place where the Pandavas and Kauravas fought their epic battle. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant called 'Shri Krishna Dhaba'. Day 2: Morning: Visit the Bhishma Kund, which is the place where Bhishma Pitamah was laid on a bed of arrows. Afternoon: Visit the Kurukshetra Museum, which houses a collection of sculptures, coins, and other artifacts related to the Mahabharata. Evening: Visit the Bhagwat Bhavan, which is a temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant called 'Kadamb Restaurant'. Day 3: Morning: Visit the Kurukshetra University, which is a prestigious educational institution. Afternoon: Visit the Sthaneshwar Mahadev Temple, which is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Evening: Visit the Sheesh Mahal, which is a palace made of mirrors. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant called 'Indraprastha Dhaba'. Day 4: Morning: Visit the Dharohar Museum, which is a museum of local culture and history. Afternoon: Visit the Sthaneshwar Temple, which is dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Evening: Visit the Palki Sahib Gurudwara, which is a religious shrine. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant called 'Chandni Chowk'. Day 5: Morning: Visit the Thanesar, which is an ancient city. Afternoon: Visit the Sannihit Sarovar, which is a holy lake. Evening: Visit the Bhishma Kund, which is the place where Bhishma Pitamah was laid on a bed of arrows. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant called 'Gulshan-e-Kurukshetra'.

Auckland is the largest city in New Zealand and the most populous urban area in the country. It is located in the North Island and is home to a diverse population, beautiful landscapes, and a vibrant culture. Day 1 - Morning Start your day in Auckland by exploring the city’s iconic Sky Tower. The Sky Tower is the tallest free-standing structure in the Southern Hemisphere and offers stunning views of the city and harbor. After taking in the sights from the top of the tower, make your way to the Auckland War Memorial Museum. Here, you can explore the rich history of the city and learn about the Maori people and their culture. Day 1 - Afternoon In the afternoon, take a stroll through the Auckland Domain. This 75-hectare park is the oldest park in the city and features lush gardens, a lake, and the Auckland Museum. After exploring the park, take a ferry to the nearby Waiheke Island. This island is home to beautiful beaches, vineyards, and olive groves. Day 1 - Evening End your day with dinner at the renowned Euro Bar & Restaurant. This restaurant is located in the heart of the city and offers an extensive menu of European-inspired dishes. Day 2 - Morning Begin your second day in Auckland with a visit to the Viaduct Harbour. This vibrant waterfront area is home to many restaurants, bars, and shops. Take a walk along the waterfront and admire the views of the harbor. Afterward, make your way to the Auckland Art Gallery. Here, you can view a variety of artworks from both local and international artists. Day 2 - Afternoon Spend the afternoon exploring the Auckland Zoo. This zoo is home to over 100 species of animals, including lions, tigers, and giraffes. Afterward, take a drive to the Waitakere Ranges. This scenic area is home to lush forests, waterfalls, and beaches. Day 2 - Evening End your day with dinner at the popular Depot Eatery & Oyster Bar. This restaurant is located on the waterfront and offers a variety of seafood dishes, as well as an extensive wine list.

Afternoon: Explore the Auckland Museum and learn about the culture and history of the region. Spend the afternoon wandering the galleries and taking in the sights. Evening: Head to the Viaduct Harbour for a night out. Enjoy the bars and restaurants, and take in the stunning harbour views. End the Day With: A meal at the award-winning Depot Eatery & Oyster Bar. Take in the bars, clubs and live music venues, and soak up the vibrant atmosphere. End the Day With: A meal at The Blue Breeze Inn. Enjoy classic New Zealand cuisine in a relaxed atmosphere.

Day 1: Morning: Start your morning by visiting the famous Kapaleeshwarar Temple in Mylapore, Chennai. This temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is one of the oldest temples in the city. You can explore the temple complex and admire the intricate carvings on the walls and pillars. Afternoon: Head to Marina Beach, the longest beach in India. Enjoy a stroll along the beach, take in the sea breeze, and relax. You can also visit the nearby aquarium and explore the variety of marine life. Evening: Enjoy the evening at Elliot’s Beach. This beach is known for its picturesque views and is a great place to watch the sunset. End the day with dinner at Saravana Bhavan, a popular South Indian restaurant. Enjoy their delicious dosas and idlis. Day 2: Morning: Visit the Government Museum and Art Gallery. This museum is home to a wide variety of artifacts and artworks from different parts of India. You can also explore the museum’s library and research centre. Afternoon: Head to the San Thome Cathedral, a beautiful church built in the Neo-Gothic style. Admire the architecture and take in the peaceful atmosphere. Evening: Explore the Fort St. George, the first English fortress in India. This fort has been declared as a heritage site and is a great place to learn about the history and culture of the city. End the day with dinner at Saravanaa Bhavan, a popular South Indian restaurant. Enjoy their delicious dosas and idlis.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by visiting the iconic Kapaleeswarar Temple, a 7th century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Take in the beautiful architecture and marvel at the intricate sculptures. After that, head to the Mylapore Tank, a large tank located in the heart of the city. Enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and take in the beauty of the surrounding temples. End the day with dinner at Saravana Bhavan, a popular local restaurant serving authentic South Indian cuisine. Day 1 Morning: Edinburgh is the capital of Scotland and is a beautiful city with stunning architecture, a rich history and plenty of attractions to explore. Start your day by visiting the iconic Edinburgh Castle, perched atop an extinct volcano. From there, take a stroll down the Royal Mile, the main thoroughfare of the Old Town, and pop into the many shops, galleries and museums. Afternoon: Continue your exploration of the city by taking a walk around the Princes Street Gardens and visit the National Museum of Scotland. Then, take a tour of the Palace of Holyroodhouse, the official residence of the British monarch in Scotland. Evening: Finish the day with a visit to the top of Calton Hill for a stunning view of the city. Afterward, enjoy some traditional Scottish cuisine at the Witchery by the Castle, a popular restaurant located in a 17th-century building. Day 2 Morning: Start your second day with a visit to the National Gallery of Scotland, home to a vast collection of art from the Renaissance to the present day. Then, take a stroll through the cobbled streets of the Old Town and explore the many hidden gems of the city. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the city’s many shops, galleries and museums. Visit the National Museum of Scotland for a unique insight into Scotland’s history and culture, and then explore the Royal Botanic Garden of Edinburgh, home to over 70,000 species of plants. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Scott Monument, a towering Gothic structure dedicated to the novelist Sir Walter Scott. Afterward, enjoy some traditional Scottish cuisine at OX184, a popular restaurant located in the heart of the city.

Day 1: Morning: Begin your day by exploring the National Mall, the most famous park in Washington D.C. Here you can visit the National Museum of American History, National Air and Space Museum, National Gallery of Art and the National Museum of Natural History. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon visiting the White House, the US Capitol Building and the Library of Congress. These are all must-see attractions when visiting Washington D.C. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the city’s many other attractions, such as the National Zoo, the Washington Monument, and the Lincoln Memorial. Day 1 – Morning Start your day with a visit to the iconic Washington Monument. This 555-foot tall marble obelisk is a symbol of the nation’s capital and a must-see for any visitor to the city. Day 1: Morning Start your day by visiting the beautiful beaches of Kerala. Take a stroll along the shoreline and enjoy the stunning views of the Arabian Sea. Day 1: Morning: Start your day by visiting the famous Brandenburg Gate, a famous landmark in Berlin. It is a symbol of both German unity and the city of Berlin. You can take a walk around the area and enjoy the beautiful architecture. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Berlin Wall Memorial. Here you can learn about the history of the Berlin Wall and the Cold War. You can also take a walk along the wall and see the various graffiti art that has been painted on it. Evening: Finish the day by visiting the Reichstag building. It is a beautiful building that houses the German parliament. Take a guided tour of the building and learn more about German politics and history. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, Curry 36. Here you can enjoy some of the best currywurst in Berlin. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Berlin Cathedral. It is a beautiful church that was built in the 19th century. Take a tour of the church and admire the stunning architecture. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Jewish Museum Berlin. Here you can learn about the history of Jewish life in Berlin and the Holocaust. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Museum Island. This is a group of five museums located on an island in the River Spree. Here you can explore the various art and historical artifacts from around the world. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, Imren Grill. Here you can enjoy some of the best Turkish cuisine in Berlin.

Day One: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the famous Brandenburg Gate. This iconic landmark is a symbol of the city and a reminder of its turbulent history. Take some time to explore the surrounding streets and explore the nearby monuments, such as the Reichstag and the Holocaust Memorial. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Museum Island, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Here you can explore a range of different museums, such as the Pergamon Museum and the Old National Gallery. Evening: End the day with a visit to the East Side Gallery, a 1.3 km long section of the Berlin Wall that has been transformed into an open-air art gallery. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant Borchardt, which offers a range of classic German dishes. Day Two: Morning: Begin the day with a visit to the Berlin Zoo. This is one of the oldest zoos in the world and is home to over 20,000 animals. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the city’s vibrant street art scene. Take a walking tour of the city’s street art hotspots and explore the works of some of the world’s most renowned street artists. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Potsdamer Platz, a bustling square filled with restaurants, bars and shops. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant Curry 36, which serves a range of traditional German currywurst. Day Three: Morning: Start the day with a visit to the iconic Alexanderplatz. Take a stroll through the Tiergarten, Berlin’s largest park, or explore the picturesque Volkspark Friedrichshain. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Berlin TV Tower, the tallest structure in Germany. From the top of the tower you can get stunning views of the city. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant Mustafas Gemüsekebap, which serves a range of delicious Turkish kebabs.

Day 1: Morning - Visit the Brandenburg Gate. This iconic structure is a symbol of German unity and a reminder of the tumultuous history of Berlin. Tourists can take pictures, explore the surrounding gardens and monuments, or even take a guided tour. Afternoon - Visit Museum Island. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is home to five of Berlin’s most important museums, including the Pergamon Museum and the Altes Museum. Tourists can spend the day exploring the collections and marveling at the architecture. Evening - End the day with a visit to the East Side Gallery. This open-air gallery is the longest remaining stretch of the Berlin Wall and features over 100 murals painted by artists from all over the world. Day 2: Morning - Visit the Tiergarten. This large park is located in the heart of Berlin and is a great place for a leisurely stroll, a picnic, or a bike ride. Tourists can also visit the nearby Berlin Zoo or the Victory Column. Afternoon - Visit the Jewish Museum. This museum chronicles the history of Jewish life in Germany from the Middle Ages to the present day. Tourists can explore the permanent exhibitions or visit the museum’s library and research center. Evening - End the day with dinner at the Katz Orange. This restaurant serves contemporary German cuisine in a relaxed atmosphere. Day 3: Morning - Visit the Berlin Wall Memorial. This memorial is dedicated to the victims of the Berlin Wall and features a section of the original wall, as well as a documentation center and a memorial chapel. Afternoon - Visit Potsdamer Platz. This square is a modern hub of Berlin and features a mix of shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues. Tourists can also visit the nearby Sony Center or take a tour of the historic square. Evening - End the day with dinner at the Prater Garten. This traditional beer garden serves up classic German dishes and a variety of beers. Day 4: Morning - Visit the Topography of Terror. This museum is located on the former site of the Gestapo and SS headquarters and chronicles the history of Nazi terror in Germany. Afternoon - Visit Checkpoint Charlie. This former border crossing between East and West Berlin is now a museum and a popular tourist destination. Tourists can learn about the history of the Berlin Wall and take pictures of the iconic guardhouse. Evening - End the day with dinner at the Curry 36. This popular fast-food restaurant serves up delicious currywurst and other traditional German dishes. Day 5: Morning - Visit the Reichstag. This iconic building is the home of the German parliament and features a glass dome that offers a stunning view of the city. Tourists can take a guided tour or explore the surrounding gardens. Afternoon - Visit the Holocaust Memorial. This memorial is dedicated to the victims of the Holocaust and features a series of concrete slabs arranged in a grid pattern. Evening - End the day with dinner at the Augustiner am Gendarmenmarkt. This restaurant serves traditional German cuisine in a cozy atmosphere. Day 6: Morning - Visit the Berlin Cathedral. This cathedral is the largest church in Berlin and features a stunning neo-Renaissance facade. Tourists can take a guided tour or explore the nearby Museum Island. Afternoon - Visit Charlottenburg Palace. This Baroque palace is the largest palace in Berlin and features beautiful gardens and a collection of artwork and antiques. Evening - End the day with dinner at the Spindler & Klatt. This restaurant serves up a variety of international dishes in a contemporary setting.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by exploring the beauty of Coonoor. Take a stroll around Sim’s Park, a 12-acre botanical garden. It is home to more than 1000 species of plants, including exotic varieties of trees, shrubs and climbers. Afternoon: After lunch, head to Dolphin’s Nose, a rocky outcrop with a stunning view of the vast valley below. This spot is a popular spot for trekkers, photographers and nature lovers. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Lamb’s Rock Viewpoint. This spot offers a breathtaking view of the mountains and valleys. End the day with dinner at the Coonoor Club, a popular restaurant serving local cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Start the day with a visit to the Highfield Tea Factory, the oldest tea factory in India. Here, you can learn about the process of tea production and taste some of the best teas in the world. Afternoon: In the afternoon, head to the Law’s Falls, a beautiful waterfall located in the heart of the city. Enjoy the fresh mountain air and the sound of the cascading water. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Ketti Valley Viewpoint. This spot offers a stunning view of the Ketti Valley and the surrounding hills. End the day with dinner at the Ketti Valley Restaurant, a popular local restaurant serving delicious local dishes.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day by visiting the Taj Mahal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This iconic building, built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in the 17th century, is considered one of the greatest architectural achievements in the world. After taking in the beauty of this building, explore the nearby Agra Fort, another UNESCO World Heritage Site. This 16th century fort, also built by Shah Jahan, is a sprawling complex of palaces and gardens. Afternoon: Take a break from sightseeing and explore the local culture at Sadar Bazaar. This bustling market is filled with shops selling everything from traditional jewelry to spices. Get a taste of the local cuisine at the many street food stalls. Evening: Enjoy a romantic boat ride on the River Yamuna, which offers stunning views of the Taj Mahal. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant, Pinch of Spice. Day 2 Morning: Visit the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah, also known as the Baby Taj. This beautiful mausoleum, built by Nur Jahan in the 17th century, features intricate carvings and inlaid marble. After, explore the nearby Mehtab Bagh gardens, which offer stunning views of the Taj Mahal. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the lanes of Kinari Bazaar and explore the many shops selling traditional crafts and souvenirs. Then, visit the nearby Jama Masjid mosque, which was built in the 16th century by Mughal emperor Akbar. Evening: End your day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Chameli. Enjoy delicious traditional dishes such as kababs, biryani, and naan.

Day 1: Morning - Gyeongbokgung Palace: Gyeongbokgung Palace is a royal palace located in Seoul, South Korea. It was built in 1395 and served as the main palace of the Joseon Dynasty. Tourists can explore the palace grounds and visit the various buildings, including the main throne hall, the National Palace Museum, and the National Folk Museum. Afternoon - Namsan Tower: Namsan Tower, also known as the Seoul Tower, is a popular tourist destination located on Namsan Mountain in central Seoul. The tower offers stunning views of the city and visitors can also explore the nearby park and gardens. Evening - Insadong: Insadong is a popular shopping district located in central Seoul. It is home to a variety of shops, restaurants, and galleries. Visitors can explore the traditional Korean shops and enjoy some of the local street food. The broth is made with anchovy, kelp, and other ingredients, and is served with a variety of toppings. Visitors can explore the traditional Korean architecture and visit the various shops, restaurants, and galleries. Visitors can explore the various shops and try some of the local street food. Evening - Cheonggyecheon Stream: Cheonggyecheon Stream is a popular tourist destination located in central Seoul. The stream is lined with walking paths and visitors can explore the various bridges and sculptures. It was built in 1405 and served as the main palace of the Joseon Dynasty. Visitors can explore the various shops and try some of the local street food. Evening - Hongdae: Hongdae is a popular entertainment district located in western Seoul. It is home to a variety of clubs, bars, and restaurants. Visitors can explore the area and enjoy some of the local nightlife. Day 1: Morning: Las Vegas is a vibrant and exciting city, known for its glittering lights and glamorous casinos. Start your day with a visit to the iconic Las Vegas Strip, where you can explore the many attractions, including the Bellagio Fountains, the Eiffel Tower at Paris Las Vegas, and the MGM Grand Hotel and Casino. You can also take a stroll along the Fremont Street Experience, where you can find a variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring some of the city’s many museums, such as the Mob Museum or the Neon Museum. You can also take a tour of the Hoover Dam, or take a trip to the Grand Canyon. If you’re feeling adventurous, you can even take a helicopter tour of the Strip. Evening: After a day of sightseeing, cap off the night with dinner and a show. Las Vegas is home to some of the best restaurants in the world, as well as world-class entertainment. From Cirque du Soleil to classic Vegas shows, there’s something for everyone. End the Day with: End your day with dinner at the popular Gordon Ramsay Steakhouse, located inside the Paris Las Vegas Hotel. Here, you can enjoy a delicious steak dinner in a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Day 1: Morning Start your day in Las Vegas with a visit to the iconic Strip. Here, you can explore the world-famous casinos, take in the vibrant atmosphere and enjoy the stunning neon lights. After that, head over to the Bellagio Fountains for a mesmerizing show of light and music. Day 1: Afternoon In the afternoon, take a stroll down Fremont Street Experience, a pedestrian mall in downtown Las Vegas. Here, you can visit the Neon Museum, check out the street performers and take in the lively atmosphere. After that, take a ride on the High Roller, the world’s tallest observation wheel. Day 1: Evening In the evening, head to the Las Vegas Strip and explore the vibrant nightlife. Here, you can visit the nightclubs, bars and casinos. After that, end the day with dinner at the Gordon Ramsay Hell's Kitchen, a restaurant located in the Caesars Palace. Day 2: Morning Start your day with a visit to the Red Rock Canyon, a stunning desert landscape located just outside of Las Vegas. Here, you can take a scenic drive, go hiking and take in the breathtaking views. After that, head over to the Hoover Dam, a massive structure located on the Colorado River. Day 2: Afternoon In the afternoon, explore the Mob Museum, a museum dedicated to the history of organized crime in the United States. Here, you can learn about the history of the mob and its impact on Las Vegas. After that, take a stroll around the Las Vegas Arts District and check out the galleries and street art. Day 2: Evening In the evening, take a ride on the Stratosphere Tower, the tallest freestanding observation tower in the United States. Here, you can take in the stunning views of the city and enjoy the thrill rides. After that, end the day with dinner at the Lotus of Siam, a Thai restaurant located in the Commercial Center. Day 3: Morning Start your day with a visit to the Neon Museum, a museum dedicated to preserving the history of Las Vegas’ iconic neon signs. Here, you can learn about the history of Las Vegas and explore the iconic signs. After that, take a walk around the Fremont East Entertainment District and explore the vibrant nightlife. Day 3: Afternoon In the afternoon, head to the Las Vegas Natural History Museum, a museum dedicated to the natural history of the area. Here, you can explore the exhibits and learn about the unique wildlife and geology of the region. After that, take a stroll around the Miracle Mile Shops and explore the shops and restaurants. Day 3: Evening In the evening, take a ride on the Big Apple Coaster, a roller coaster located in the New York-New York Hotel & Casino. Here, you can experience the thrill of the ride and take in the stunning views of the city. After that, end the day with dinner at the Peppermill, a classic Las Vegas diner.

Here you can experience the morning aarti ceremony, a spiritual ritual of worship, and take in the beauty of the surrounding mountains. Afternoon: Head to the Lakshman Jhula, a 450-foot suspension bridge that crosses the Ganges. Here you can take in the views of the river and the surrounding hills. You can also visit the nearby temples and ashrams or take part in some of the adventure activities like river rafting and camping. Evening: As the sun sets, take a stroll along the banks of the Ganges and watch the evening aarti ceremony. You can also take a boat ride along the river or explore the nearby markets for souvenirs. End the day with dinner at the Chotiwala Restaurant, a popular local eatery that serves up delicious Indian cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Neelkanth Mahadev Temple, a revered Hindu temple located at the foot of the Himalayas. Here you can explore the temple complex and take in the stunning views of the surrounding hills. Afternoon: Head to the Parmarth Niketan Ashram, one of the largest ashrams in India. Here you can take part in yoga and meditation classes, enjoy a traditional Indian massage, or take a dip in the holy Ganges. Evening: As the sun sets, explore the nearby markets and enjoy some of the local street food. You can also take part in activities like bungee jumping, rappelling, and zip lining. End the day with dinner at the Ganga Beach Restaurant, a popular local spot that serves up delicious Indian and international cuisine.

Day 1 - Morning Start your day with a visit to the historical monuments of Jammu and Kashmir. Day 1 Morning: Visit the Mughal Gardens in Jammu and Kashmir. These Mughal-style gardens are a must-see for any visitor to the area and feature a variety of plants and trees. Day 1: Morning: Visit the Vaishno Devi temple, located in the Trikuta Mountains of Jammu and Kashmir. Day 1: Morning: Start your day in Zurich with a visit to the Lindenhof, a public square in the heart of the city. Evening: End the day with dinner at the Kronenhalle, a popular restaurant that serves traditional Swiss dishes.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day exploring the city of Munich. Visit the iconic Marienplatz, the central square of the city, and take in the beautiful architecture of the New Town Hall. Admire the Glockenspiel, a traditional clock tower that chimes and moves figurines every day at 11am, 12pm and 5pm. Enjoy the views of the city from the top of St. Peter's Church and take a stroll in the English Garden, the largest public park in the city. Afternoon: Head to the Deutsches Museum, one of the world’s largest science and technology museums. Explore its many interactive exhibits, from transportation to electricity and from space to music. End the afternoon with a visit to the Olympic Stadium, the site of the 1972 Summer Olympics. Evening: Experience Munich’s nightlife by visiting some of its many beer gardens. Enjoy a traditional Bavarian meal and a beer in one of the city’s oldest beer gardens, the Augustiner Keller. End the day with a visit to the Hofbrauhaus, Munich’s most popular beer hall, for some traditional Bavarian food and music. Day 2 Morning: Start your day by visiting the Nymphenburg Palace, the former summer residence of the Bavarian royal family. Explore the palace’s many gardens and its grand Baroque architecture. Afterward, head to the BMW Museum, where you can learn about the history and development of the famous German car brand. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon at the Pinakothek der Moderne, an art museum featuring works from the 20th and 21st centuries. Explore the museum’s many collections of modern art and design. End the afternoon with a visit to the Munich Residenz, the former royal palace of the Wittelsbach family. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Bavarian dinner at the Augustiner am Platzl restaurant, located in the heart of Munich’s old town. End the day with a visit to Königsplatz, a square located in the heart of the city, to enjoy the views of the city at night.

Day 1: Morning Start your day with a visit to the Marienplatz, the heart of Munich. Day 1: Morning: Visit the City Palace of Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan. It is a majestic palace complex, built in the 18th century, and is a great example of Rajasthani architecture. Tourists can explore the palace, its courtyards, gardens, and many other attractions. Afternoon: Visit the Amer Fort, located on a hilltop in Amer. This grand fort was built in the 16th century and is an excellent example of Rajasthani architecture. Tourists can explore the fort, its courtyards, gardens, and many other attractions. Evening: Visit the Jantar Mantar in Jaipur, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is an observatory built in the 18th century, and is a great example of Rajasthani architecture. Tourists can explore the observatory, its courtyards, gardens, and many other attractions. End the day with: Dinner at Chokhi Dhani, a popular Rajasthani restaurant. It is a great place to enjoy traditional Rajasthani cuisine and experience the culture of Rajasthan. Day 2: Morning: Visit the Mehrangarh Fort in Jodhpur, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a majestic fort, built in the 15th century, and is a great example of Rajasthani architecture. Tourists can explore the fort, its courtyards, gardens, and many other attractions. Afternoon: Visit the Udaipur City Palace, the largest palace complex in Rajasthan. It is a majestic palace complex, built in the 16th century, and is a great example of Rajasthani architecture. Tourists can explore the palace, its courtyards, gardens, and many other attractions. Evening: Visit the Lake Palace in Udaipur, a beautiful palace built on an island in the middle of Lake Pichola. It is a majestic palace, built in the 18th century, and is a great example of Rajasthani architecture. Tourists can explore the palace, its courtyards, gardens, and many other attractions. End the day with: Dinner at the Ambrai Restaurant, a popular local food place in Udaipur. It is a great place to enjoy traditional Rajasthani cuisine and experience the culture of Rajasthan.

Day 1: Jaipur Morning: Start your tour of Rajasthan with a visit to the beautiful city of Jaipur. Visit the iconic Hawa Mahal, or Palace of Winds, a stunning building with intricately carved balconies and windows. Then explore the City Palace, the former royal residence, and the Jantar Mantar, an 18th-century astronomical observatory. Afternoon: Take a tour of the Amber Fort, an impressive hilltop palace complex. Then head to the Nahargarh Fort, which offers stunning views of the city. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Rajasthani dinner at Chokhi Dhani, a lively cultural village with a variety of activities. End the day with: Dinner at the popular local eatery Lassiwala, known for its delicious lassi (yogurt-based drink). Day 2: Udaipur Morning: Head to Udaipur, the City of Lakes. Visit the City Palace, a sprawling complex of palaces, courtyards, and gardens. Then explore the Jagdish Temple, a beautiful Hindu temple. Afternoon: Take a boat ride on Lake Pichola and admire the views of the city. Then head to the Saheliyon Ki Bari, a beautiful garden with fountains and marble elephants. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Rajasthani dinner at the popular restaurant Ambrai. End the day with: A sweet treat at the legendary Mewar Sweet Shop, known for its delicious desserts. Day 3: Jodhpur Morning: Visit the majestic Mehrangarh Fort, located on a hilltop overlooking the city. Then explore the Jaswant Thada, a royal cenotaph made of white marble. Afternoon: Take a tour of the Umaid Bhawan Palace, a lavish palace built in the early 20th century. Then head to the Mandore Gardens, a sprawling garden with ancient temples and cenotaphs. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Rajasthani dinner at the popular restaurant Bhati Rajputana. End the day with: A delicious dessert at the famous Sweet Corner, known for its delicious gulab jamuns. Day 4: Jaisalmer Morning: Head to Jaisalmer, the Golden City. Visit the Jaisalmer Fort, a 12th-century fort built on a hilltop. Then explore the Patwon Ki Haveli, a grand haveli with intricate carvings and paintings. Afternoon: Take a camel ride through the Thar Desert and admire the beautiful desert landscape. Then head to the Gadisar Lake, a beautiful lake surrounded by temples and ghats. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Rajasthani dinner at the popular restaurant Rajasthali. End the day with: A sweet treat at the famous Sweet Corner, known for its delicious jalebi.

Day 1: Jaipur A.M: Jaipur, the Pink City of India, is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Rajasthan. Start your morning by visiting the famous Hawa Mahal and City Palace. After that, take a stroll at the colorful markets of Johari Bazaar and Bapu Bazaar. P.M: In the afternoon, visit the Amer Fort and take a refreshing elephant ride. After that, explore the nearby Jal Mahal and Nahargarh Fort. E.V: End your day with dinner at the Chokhi Dhani, a traditional Rajasthani village-themed restaurant. After that, explore the nearby Jagdish Temple, Saheliyon Ki Bari, and Fateh Sagar Lake. P.M: In the afternoon, take a boat ride at Lake Pichola and visit the Jag Mandir Palace. After that, take a cable car ride at the Monsoon Palace and explore the nearby Moti Magri Hill. E.V: End your day with dinner at the Lake Palace, a popular restaurant located on the banks of Lake Pichola. E.V: End your day with dinner at the Indique, a popular local restaurant serving traditional Rajasthani cuisine. P.M: In the afternoon, take a camel ride at the Sam Sand Dunes and explore the nearby Thar Desert. After that, visit the Gadisar Lake and explore the nearby Jain Temples. E.V: End your day with dinner at the Rajwada, a popular local restaurant serving traditional Rajasthani cuisine. Day 1: Morning: Kausani is a beautiful hill station in the state of Uttarakhand. It is known for its picturesque views of the Himalayas and its lush green surroundings. After that, you can explore the nearby attractions such as the Baijnath Temple, Rudradhari Falls and Caves, and Kausani Tea Estate. Afternoon: After lunch, you can go for a trek to the nearby peaks of Kausani. You can also take a cable car ride to the top of the hills. You can also visit the local markets and buy some souvenirs from the local artisans. Evening: In the evening, you can enjoy the sunset from the top of the hills. You can also visit the nearby villages and interact with the locals. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Shikhar Restaurant, which serves delicious local dishes. After that, you can visit the nearby attractions such as the Bageshwar Temple, Kausani Lake, and the Kausani View Point. Afternoon: After lunch, you can go for a nature walk in the nearby forests and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Himalayas. You can also visit the nearby villages and interact with the locals. Evening: In the evening, you can take a leisurely stroll along the banks of the Gomti River. You can also visit the nearby attractions such as the Gandhi Ashram, the Kausani Tea Estate, and the Kausani View Point. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Kausani Kitchen, which serves delicious local dishes.

Kausani is a beautiful hill station located in the Bageshwar district of Uttarakhand. It is surrounded by lush green pine forests and offers spectacular views of the Himalayas. Day 1: Morning: Start your day by exploring the iconic Royal Palace of Madrid, a grand palace that has been the official residence of the Spanish Royal Family since the 18th century. Take a tour of the palace and its lush gardens, and admire the beautiful frescoes and tapestries that adorn the walls. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon strolling around the Plaza Mayor, Madrid’s main square. Here you can admire the stunning architecture of the buildings, as well as browse the many shops and restaurants that line the square. Evening: Head to the Gran Via, Madrid’s main shopping street, to do some shopping and people-watching. You can also catch a show at one of the many theaters along the street. End the day with dinner at La Tasquita de Enfrente, a traditional Spanish restaurant that serves delicious tapas and other local dishes. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Prado Museum, one of the world’s most renowned art galleries. Here you’ll find works by Goya, Velázquez, and other Spanish masters. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the beautiful Buen Retiro Park. This park features gardens, fountains, and a lake, and is a great place to relax and enjoy some fresh air. Evening: Spend the evening in the trendy Malasaña neighborhood. Here you can explore the many vintage shops, bars, and cafés, and get a sense of Madrid’s vibrant nightlife. End the day with dinner at Taberna La Carmencita, a popular tapas bar that serves delicious traditional Spanish dishes.

Afternoon: Head to the Sydney Fish Market to sample some of the freshest seafood in the city. After that, take a walk around the vibrant Darling Harbour, where you can find some of the best restaurants and entertainment venues in the city. Evening: Take a stroll along the Bondi Beach to enjoy the sunset. Afterwards, enjoy a delicious dinner at one of the many restaurants in the area. End the day with a visit to the famous Icebergs Dining Room & Bar for an unforgettable dining experience. Day 2: Morning: Start your day by visiting the iconic Sydney Opera House. Take a guided tour to learn more about the history of this world-famous building. After that, take a walk around the nearby Royal Botanic Gardens to admire the stunning views of the harbour. Afternoon: Visit the historic Rocks area of Sydney to explore the city’s colonial past. Then, take a walk around the vibrant Circular Quay to admire the stunning views of the harbour. Evening: Take a stroll around the vibrant Kings Cross area to explore the city’s nightlife. Afterwards, enjoy a delicious dinner at one of the many restaurants in the area. End the day with a visit to the popular Longrain restaurant for an unforgettable dining experience.

Day 1: Morning: Start the day at the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge. Take a walk across the bridge and admire the stunning views of the city skyline and the harbour. Afternoon: Head to the Sydney Opera House, one of the most recognisable landmarks in the world. Take a guided tour of the building and learn about its history. Evening: Spend the evening in the vibrant Darling Harbour. Enjoy the restaurants, bars, and attractions, or take a stroll along the waterfront. End the day with dinner at the renowned seafood restaurant, Fish at the Rocks. Day 2: Morning: Take a ferry ride to Manly Beach and explore the beautiful coastal town. Enjoy the stunning views of the harbour, and take a swim in the ocean. Afternoon: Visit the historic Rocks area and take a tour of the cobbled streets and old buildings. Stop for lunch at one of the many cafes and restaurants. Evening: Catch a show at the iconic Sydney Theatre Company. Afterwards, head to the nearby Chinatown area for dinner. End the day with a meal at the popular Chinese restaurant, Golden Century. Day 3: Morning: Head to the popular Bondi Beach and take a walk along the boardwalk. Enjoy the stunning views of the ocean and the beach. Afternoon: Take a tour of the Royal Botanic Gardens and explore the lush gardens and native wildlife. Evening: Spend the evening in the trendy Surry Hills area. Enjoy the restaurants and bars, or take a stroll through the streets and admire the street art. End the day with dinner at the popular Italian restaurant, Porteño.

Day 1: Morning - Visit the iconic Sydney Opera House, the world-famous performing arts center located in the heart of Sydney. Take a tour of the building and its history, then enjoy a performance or take in the views of Sydney Harbor. Afternoon - Spend the afternoon exploring the Royal Botanic Garden Sydney, a 30-hectare oasis in the heart of the city. Enjoy the lush gardens, take a guided tour, or simply relax and take in the beauty of this peaceful sanctuary. Evening - Take a stroll around the bustling Darling Harbor and explore the many attractions, restaurants and shops. End the day with dinner at the award-winning Tetsuya's, one of the most popular restaurants in Sydney. Day 2: Morning - Visit the historic Rocks district, the birthplace of modern Sydney. Learn about the area's colorful past and explore the many historic buildings, galleries and markets. Afternoon - Take a ferry ride across the harbor to Manly Beach, one of Sydney's most popular beaches. Enjoy a day of sun, sand and sea, or explore the many shops and restaurants. Evening - Enjoy the nightlife of Kings Cross, one of Sydney's most vibrant areas. Take in the sights and sounds of this lively district, then end the day with dinner at one of the many local restaurants. Day 3: Morning - Take a tour of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, one of the world's most iconic structures. Learn about the bridge's history and take in the views of the harbor. Afternoon - Spend the afternoon exploring the historic Rocks district. Take a tour of the area's many historic buildings and explore the markets and galleries. Evening - Enjoy a night out in the trendy Surry Hills district. Take in the sights and sounds of this vibrant area, then end the day with dinner at one of the many local restaurants. Day 4: Morning - Take a trip to Bondi Beach, one of Sydney's most famous beaches. Enjoy a day of sun, sand and sea, or explore the many shops and restaurants. Afternoon - Visit the Sydney Tower, the tallest structure in the city. Enjoy the breathtaking views of the city from the observation deck, or take a ride on the glass-fronted elevator. Evening - Take a stroll around the vibrant Oxford Street, one of the city's most popular areas. Enjoy the sights and sounds of the city, then end the day with dinner at the popular Longrain restaurant.

Day 1: Morning: Visit St. Mark’s Basilica, one of the most iconic monuments in Venice. Enjoy the stunning architecture and artworks inside. Afternoon: Take a gondola ride along the Grand Canal and explore the hidden canals of Venice. Evening: Take a stroll along the famous Rialto Bridge and explore the colorful markets of Venice. End the day with: Dinner at Trattoria Da Remigio, a popular restaurant serving traditional Venetian cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Take a boat tour of the Venetian lagoon and explore the islands of Murano, Burano, and Torcello. Afternoon: Visit the Doge’s Palace and admire the impressive architecture and artworks inside. Evening: Take a romantic walk along the Ponte dei Sospiri (Bridge of Sighs) and explore the picturesque streets of Venice. End the day with: Dinner at Al Gazzettino, a local restaurant serving delicious Italian dishes.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day with a visit to the iconic St. Mark’s Square, the heart of Venice. Explore the beautiful basilica and marvel at the Doge’s Palace. Don’t forget to take in the stunning views of the Grand Canal and the Bridge of Sighs. Afternoon: Take a gondola ride along the canals of Venice, and admire the beautiful Venetian architecture. Stop off at the Rialto Bridge, one of the oldest bridges in the city, and browse the market stalls for souvenirs. Evening: Enjoy a romantic dinner in one of the many restaurants in the area. End the day with dinner at Ristorante La Caravella, a local favourite known for its seafood dishes. Day 2 Morning: Take a trip to the island of Murano, famous for its glass-blowing artisans. Visit the many workshops and galleries, and take home a unique souvenir. Afternoon: Head to the island of Burano, famous for its brightly coloured houses. Wander through the narrow streets and explore the many shops and galleries. Evening: Take a romantic evening stroll along the canals and admire the beautiful Venetian sunset. End the day with dinner at Osteria Alla Vedova, a local restaurant known for its delicious seafood dishes. Day 3 Morning: Visit the Peggy Guggenheim Collection, a famous modern art museum. Browse the galleries and take in the stunning views of the Grand Canal. Afternoon: Take a trip to the island of San Giorgio Maggiore and admire the stunning views of Venice from the bell tower. Stop off at the San Giorgio Monastery and explore the beautiful gardens. Evening: Enjoy a romantic dinner in one of the many restaurants in the area. End the day with dinner at Trattoria Alla Rivetta, a local favourite known for its delicious Venetian cuisine.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day in Venice by taking a tour of the Grand Canal. You’ll get a great view of the city from the water and see some of the iconic sights of Venice, such as the Rialto Bridge and the Doge’s Palace. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the city’s many churches and other religious sites. Visit St. Mark’s Basilica, the Church of San Giorgio Maggiore, and the Church of San Zaccaria. Evening: Take a stroll through the narrow streets of Venice and explore the city’s many shops and markets. Don’t forget to stop and enjoy a traditional Venetian gondola ride. End the day with dinner at Osteria Alle Testiere, a popular seafood restaurant located in the heart of Venice. Day 2: Morning: Spend the morning exploring the art galleries and museums of Venice. Visit the Galleria dell’Accademia and the Peggy Guggenheim Collection to see some of the world’s finest works of art. Afternoon: Take a day trip to the nearby islands of Murano and Burano. Enjoy the colorful buildings and canals of both islands, and explore the local shops and markets. Evening: Take a romantic gondola ride through the canals of Venice and enjoy the city’s unique atmosphere. End the day with dinner at Antica Trattoria Poste Vecie, a local restaurant known for its traditional Venetian cuisine. Day 3: Morning: Spend the morning exploring the city’s many parks and gardens. Visit the Giardini della Biennale and the Giardini Reali to enjoy some of Venice’s most beautiful outdoor spaces. Afternoon: Visit the island of San Giorgio Maggiore and explore the historic church and monastery. Take a stroll around the island and enjoy the beautiful views of Venice. Evening: Spend the evening exploring the city’s many bars and restaurants. Enjoy a few drinks and some delicious Italian food. End the day with dinner at Osteria Alle Botteghe, a popular restaurant located in the heart of Venice. Day 4: Morning: Spend the morning exploring the city’s many historic buildings and monuments. Visit the Doge’s Palace and the Campanile di San Marco to learn more about Venice’s long and fascinating history. Afternoon: Take a day trip to the nearby islands of Lido and Pellestrina. Enjoy the beautiful beaches and explore the local shops and markets. Evening: Spend the evening wandering through the narrow streets of Venice and enjoy the city’s unique atmosphere. End the day with dinner at Trattoria alla Rivetta, a local restaurant known for its traditional Venetian cuisine.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the iconic St. Mark’s Square, the heart of Venice. Take in the beauty of the city and explore the St. Mark’s Basilica, Doge’s Palace, and the Campanile. Afternoon: Take a gondola ride through the canals of Venice and explore the city from a different perspective. Stop by the colorful Rialto Bridge and enjoy the views. Evening: Spend the evening wandering the narrow streets of Venice and exploring the charming shops and restaurants. Stop by the famous Piazza San Marco and take in the stunning views of the city. End the day with dinner at La Bitta, a popular local restaurant serving traditional Venetian cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Peggy Guggenheim Collection, a modern art museum located in the Palazzo Venier dei Leoni. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Jewish Ghetto of Venice, the oldest Jewish Ghetto in the world. Take a tour of the Ghetto and learn about the history of the Jewish community in Venice. Evening: Spend the evening strolling along the Grand Canal and admiring the palaces and churches along the way. Stop by the Museo Correr to explore its collection of Renaissance and Baroque art. End the day with dinner at Osteria al Squero, a local restaurant serving traditional Venetian dishes. Day 3: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Lido of Venice, an island located just off the coast of Venice. Spend the morning exploring the beaches and taking in the views of the city. Afternoon: Take a boat ride to the island of Murano and explore the island’s famous glass factories. Watch the craftsmen at work and take a piece of Murano glass home with you. Evening: Spend the evening exploring the streets of Venice and admiring the architecture. Stop by the Santa Maria della Salute church and take in the views of the Grand Canal. End the day with dinner at Ristorante Alla Madonna, a popular local restaurant serving traditional Venetian dishes. Day 4: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Gallerie dell’Accademia, a museum located in the heart of Venice. Explore the museum’s collection of Renaissance and Baroque art. Afternoon: Take a boat ride to the island of Burano and explore the colorful streets and canals. Stop by the lace-making shops and take a piece of Burano lace home with you. Evening: Spend the evening exploring the streets of Venice and admiring the architecture. Stop by the Teatro La Fenice and take in a performance of classical music or opera. End the day with dinner at Da Fiore, a popular local restaurant serving traditional Venetian dishes. Day 5: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the island of Torcello, the oldest inhabited island in the Venetian Lagoon. Explore the island’s churches and take in the views of the lagoon. Afternoon: Take a boat ride to the island of San Giorgio Maggiore and explore the island’s famous church and monastery. Take in the views of the Grand Canal and the city of Venice. Evening: Spend the evening exploring the streets of Venice and admiring the architecture. Stop by the Ponte dell’Accademia and take in the views of the Grand Canal. End the day with dinner at Da Ivo, a popular local restaurant serving traditional Venetian dishes.

Day 1 - Morning Start your day with a visit to Pelling, a picturesque town in the state of Sikkim. Located at an altitude of 2,150 meters, Pelling is surrounded by lush green hills, snow-capped mountains, and crystal clear waterfalls. Explore the nearby attractions such as the Kanchenjunga Waterfalls, the Singshore Bridge, the Khecheopalri Lake, and the Rabdentse Ruins. You can also take a cable car ride to the top of the hills to get a panoramic view of the town. Day 1 - Afternoon In the afternoon, visit the Pemayangtse Monastery, the oldest and most important monastery in Sikkim. The monastery is home to several ancient religious artifacts and is a great place to experience the Buddhist culture of the region. After the monastery, take a stroll through the town and visit some of the local shops and cafes. Day 1 - Evening In the evening, head to the nearby Yuksom Village, the first capital of Sikkim. Here, you can explore the traditional Buddhist culture of the region, take a stroll through the village, and explore the nearby attractions such as the Dubdi Monastery and the Norbugang Chorten. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, The Green Bamboo, which serves delicious traditional Sikkimese cuisine. Day 2 - Morning Start your day with a visit to the Kanchenjunga National Park, the second largest national park in India. Here, you can explore the diverse flora and fauna of the region and spot some of the rarest species of animals and birds. After the park, head to the nearby Khangchendzonga Biosphere Reserve, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and explore the unique ecosystem of the region. Day 2 - Afternoon In the afternoon, take a trip to the nearby Singshore Bridge, the highest bridge in Sikkim. After that, head to the Pemayangtse Monastery and explore the ancient religious artifacts and sculptures. You can also take a cable car ride to the top of the hills for a panoramic view of the town. Day 2 - Evening In the evening, take a stroll through the town and visit some of the local shops and cafes. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, The Cloud Nine, which serves delicious traditional Sikkimese cuisine.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by visiting the Pemayangtse Monastery, one of the oldest and most important monasteries in Sikkim. Admire the stunning architecture and take in the peaceful atmosphere of the place. Afternoon: After lunch, explore the Rabdentse Ruins, the former palace of the kingdom of Sikkim. Take a stroll through the ruins and get a glimpse into the history of the place. Evening: Visit the Kanchenjunga Waterfalls and marvel at the beauty of the cascading water. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, The Lotus, where you can sample delicious traditional Sikkimese cuisine. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the sacred Khecheopalri Lake, a holy site for Buddhists. Spend some time here and soak in the spiritual atmosphere of the place. Evening: Visit the Pemayangtse View Point and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Kanchenjunga mountain range. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, The Pelling Bistro, where you can sample delicious local dishes. Day 3: Morning: Explore the Kanchenjunga National Park and take in the stunning views of the park's flora and fauna. Afternoon: Visit the Pemayangtse Zoo and take a look at the various species of animals that call this place home. Evening: Take a leisurely stroll through the Pelling Market and pick up some souvenirs to remember your trip. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, The Dragon's Den, where you can sample delicious traditional Sikkimese cuisine.

Day 1 Morning: Start the day with a visit to the Sacred Valley of the Incas. This stunning valley is located between Cusco and the ancient Inca capital of Machu Picchu. Here you can explore the ruins of the Inca cities of Pisac" target="_blank" >Pisac and Ollantaytambo, take a guided tour of the valley, or just take in the stunning scenery. Afternoon: Continue your tour of the region by taking a trip to the archaeological site of Sacsayhuaman. This impressive fortress is located on the outskirts of Cusco and is one of the most important Inca ruins in the region. Here you can explore the ruins, learn about the Inca culture, and take in the breathtaking views of the city of Cusco. Evening: End the day with a visit to San Blas, the artistic neighborhood of Cusco. Here you can explore the colorful streets, visit the local artisan shops, and take in the vibrant atmosphere of the city. Day 2 Morning: Start the day with a visit to the nearby city of Pisac" target="_blank" >Pisac. Here you can explore the ancient ruins of the Inca city, take in the stunning views of the Sacred Valley, and visit the local markets. Afternoon: Continue your tour of the region with a trip to the nearby town of Chinchero. This quaint village is home to a number of traditional Inca ruins, as well as stunning views of the surrounding mountains. Evening: End the day with a visit to the popular restaurant, La Bodega. Here you can try some of the best traditional Peruvian dishes, such as ceviche and lomo saltado.

Cinque Terre is a beautiful coastal region in the Italian Riviera, known for its five fishing villages and stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea. Day 1: Morning: Start your day in the village of Monterosso, the largest of the five villages. Take a stroll along the beach, explore the old town, and admire the beautiful views of the sea. Afternoon: Head to Vernazza and explore the village’s shops and restaurants. Take a boat tour to get a better view of the coastline. Evening: Take the train to Manarola and enjoy the sunset over the beautiful harbor. End the day with dinner at La Torre, a local seafood restaurant. Day 2: Morning: Begin the day in Riomaggiore, the southernmost of the five villages. Take a hike along the coastal path, known as the Sentiero Azzurro, for stunning views of the sea. Afternoon: Take the train to Corniglia, the only village not located directly on the sea. Explore the winding streets of the village and take in the views from the top of the hill. Evening: Head to the village of Vernazza for dinner. Enjoy the local seafood dishes at Trattoria dal Billy. End the day with a glass of local wine and a stroll along the harbor.

Day 1: Morning: Cinque Terre is a stunning coastal region in Italy, made up of five villages: Monterosso al Mare, Vernazza, Corniglia, Manarola, and Riomaggiore. Begin your tour by visiting Monterosso al Mare, the largest of the five villages. Here, you can spend the morning strolling through the streets, admiring the colorful houses, and enjoying the beautiful views of the Mediterranean Sea. Afternoon: Take a boat ride to the other villages, exploring the picturesque harbors and coves. Stop for a refreshing swim in the crystal clear waters, or take a hike along the coastal trails. If you’re feeling adventurous, try some of the local seafood dishes and wines. Evening: End the day with dinner at the Ristorante La Torre in Riomaggiore, where you can enjoy traditional Ligurian cuisine and stunning views of the sea. Day 2: Morning: Take a day trip to the nearby town of Portovenere, located just south of the Cinque Terre. Here, you can explore the ancient churches and fortifications, and take in the stunning views of the Mediterranean. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon in Vernazza, the most picturesque of the five villages. Here, you can visit the Church of Santa Margherita di Antiochia, take a stroll along the harbor, or sample some of the delicious local cuisine. Evening: End the day with dinner at Trattoria da Sandro, a cozy restaurant located in the heart of Vernazza. Enjoy the fresh seafood dishes and the stunning views of the harbor. Day 3: Morning: Begin your day with a visit to the village of Manarola. Here, you can take a boat ride to the nearby Grotto dell’Arpaia, a stunning sea cave, or take a stroll along the seaside promenade. Afternoon: Take a hike along the Via dell’Amore, a stunning coastal trail that connects Manarola to Riomaggiore. Enjoy the stunning views of the Mediterranean and the terraced vineyards. Evening: End the day with dinner at Trattoria dal Billy, a cozy restaurant in Manarola. Enjoy the delicious seafood dishes and the stunning views of the harbor.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Antalya Museum, one of the best museums in Turkey. The museum houses a huge collection of artifacts from the ancient city of Perge, as well as other artifacts from the region. After exploring the museum, take a walk around the old city and visit the Hadrian’s Gate, the Clock Tower and the Yivli Minare. Afterward, head to one of the popular local restaurants such as Kebabci for a delicious dinner.

Day 1 Morning: Start the day with a visit to the Sagrada Familia, one of Barcelona's most iconic landmarks. It is an unfinished Roman Catholic church designed by Catalan architect Antoni Gaudi. Tourists can explore the grand interior, admire the intricate details and take in the breathtaking views from the top. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Gothic Quarter, the city's old town. Take a stroll through the narrow streets, visit the old churches and explore the historical buildings. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants to choose from, so take a break and sample some of the local cuisine. Evening: Enjoy the vibrant nightlife in Barcelona. Take a walk along the beachfront and enjoy the views of the Mediterranean Sea. Stop by one of the many bars, clubs or restaurants and enjoy some live music or a drink. End the day with dinner at El Xampanyet, a popular tapas bar in the Gothic Quarter. Day 2 Morning: Start the day with a visit to the Park Güell. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is a public park designed by Antoni Gaudi. Explore the colorful mosaic tiled benches and terraces, take in the views of the city and admire the architectural details. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the vibrant Las Ramblas area. Take a stroll along the pedestrianized street, browse the stalls of the Boqueria market, visit the La Boquería theatre and check out the street performers. Evening: Enjoy the nightlife in El Raval, one of the city's trendiest neighborhoods. Take a walk through the streets and explore the shops, galleries and bars. End the day with dinner at El Nacional, a popular restaurant serving traditional Catalan cuisine.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day with a visit to the iconic Belem Tower, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The tower is a symbol of Portugal's Age of Discovery, and is located on the banks of the Tagus River. From there, take a leisurely stroll along the river and visit the Monument to the Discoveries, which celebrates the Portuguese explorers of the 15th and 16th centuries. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the cobblestone streets of the Alfama district, Lisbon's oldest neighborhood. Here, you'll find colorful buildings, quaint cafes and shops, as well as the 12th-century São Jorge Castle. Afterward, take a ride on the iconic Tram 28 and enjoy the views of the city. Evening: Head to the Bairro Alto district to experience Lisbon's vibrant nightlife. Here, you'll find a variety of bars, clubs, and restaurants to choose from. End the day with dinner at the popular Terra restaurant, where you can enjoy traditional Portuguese cuisine. Day 2 Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Jeronimos Monastery, a 16th-century UNESCO World Heritage Site. This stunning monastery is one of Lisbon's most popular attractions and is home to the tomb of the explorer Vasco da Gama. Afterward, take a stroll through the nearby Belém Cultural Center, which features a variety of art galleries, shops, and restaurants. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the streets of the Chiado district. This trendy area is home to a variety of shops, cafes, and restaurants. Here, you can enjoy a relaxing cup of coffee or browse the local boutiques. Evening: End the day with dinner at the popular A Cevicheria restaurant, where you can enjoy a variety of fresh seafood dishes. Afterward, take a stroll along the waterfront and enjoy the views of the city.
