Visit the Castle of Sao Jorge, the Santa Justa Elevator, and the Rossio Square. Afternoon: Take a tour of the city's many museums and galleries. Explore the National Museum of Ancient Art, the Calouste Gulbenkian Museum, and the Gulbenkian Foundation. Evening: Enjoy a romantic evening in the city's oldest neighborhood, Alfama. Explore its narrow winding streets, and take in the unique atmosphere. End the day with dinner at the local favorite, Restaurante Bairro de Alfama, where you can sample traditional Portuguese dishes.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day in Lisbon by exploring the iconic Jerónimos Monastery. Take in the beautiful architecture and learn about the history of this magnificent building. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the cobblestone streets of Alfama, the oldest district in Lisbon. Enjoy the traditional Portuguese culture and explore the local shops and restaurants. Evening: Visit one of Lisbon’s most popular attractions, the Castelo de São Jorge. Take in the beautiful views of the city and learn about the history of the castle. End the day with a meal at A Cevicheria, a popular seafood restaurant in Lisbon. Day 2: Morning: Take a trip to the Belem Tower, one of Lisbon’s most iconic landmarks. Learn about the history of the tower and take in the breathtaking views of the Tagus River. Afternoon: Visit the Gulbenkian Museum, one of the leading art museums in Lisbon. Explore the vast collection of art and artifacts from around the world. Evening: Take a stroll through the vibrant Chiado district. Enjoy the unique atmosphere and explore the local shops and cafes. End the day with a meal at A Travessa, a popular restaurant offering traditional Portuguese cuisine. Day 3: Morning: Visit the National Tile Museum, which showcases the history and art of Portuguese tiles. Learn about the history and admire the beautiful artwork. Afternoon: Take a walk through the picturesque Rossio Square. Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere and explore the local shops and cafes. Evening: Head to the Oceanario de Lisboa, the largest aquarium in Europe. Explore the underwater world and learn about the many species of marine life. End the day with a meal at A Cozinha do Mane, a popular seafood restaurant in Lisbon. Day 4: Morning: Take a trip to the Calouste Gulbenkian Museum, which houses an impressive collection of art and artifacts from around the world. Afternoon: Visit the Museu Nacional de Arte Antiga, a museum dedicated to the history of Portuguese art. Explore the extensive collection of artwork and learn about the history of Portuguese art. Evening: Head to the Parque Eduardo VII, one of Lisbon’s largest parks. Enjoy the beautiful gardens and take in the stunning views of the city. End the day with a meal at Restaurante O Gaveto, a popular restaurant offering traditional Portuguese cuisine. Day 5: Morning: Take a stroll through the historic Bairro Alto district. Enjoy the unique atmosphere and explore the local shops and cafes. Afternoon: Visit the Museu Nacional dos Coches, a museum dedicated to the history of Portuguese carriages. Explore the extensive collection of carriages and learn about the history of Portuguese transportation. Evening: Take a trip to the beautiful Praça do Comércio, one of Lisbon’s most iconic squares. Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere and take in the stunning views of the Tagus River. End the day with a meal at Restaurante O Faial, a popular seafood restaurant in Lisbon.

Day 1: Morning - Tour the Alfama District: Start the day off by exploring the Alfama district, the oldest neighborhood in Lisbon. Here, you can explore the winding cobblestone streets and visit the many churches, such as São Vicente de Fora and the Church of St. Anthony. Afternoon - Take a Tram Ride: Take a ride on the iconic yellow trams that run through the city. Enjoy the unique views of the city from the tram and take a tour of the city’s most famous landmarks, like the Praça do Comércio and the Belém Tower. Evening - Visit the Miradouro de Santa Luzia: Take in the stunning views of the city from the Miradouro de Santa Luzia. This viewpoint offers views of the Tagus River, the red roofs of Lisbon, and the Castelo de São Jorge. End the day with dinner at the Botequim Do Martim, a traditional Portuguese restaurant. Day 2: Morning - Tour the São Jorge Castle: Spend the morning exploring the São Jorge Castle. Admire the castle’s ancient architecture and take in the spectacular views of the city from the castle walls. Afternoon - Visit the Gulbenkian Museum: Spend the afternoon exploring the Gulbenkian Museum. This museum houses an impressive collection of art, including works by Rembrandt, Monet, and Picasso. Evening - Take a Fado Show: Enjoy a traditional Fado show in the evening. This unique musical style originated in Lisbon and is characterized by its melancholic tunes and passionate singing. End the evening with dinner at the Solar dos Presuntos, a popular Portuguese restaurant. Day 3: Morning - Tour the Belem District: Start the day off by exploring the Belem district. Here, you can visit the Jeronimos Monastery, the Monument to the Discoveries, and the Tower of Belem. Afternoon - Visit the Calouste Gulbenkian Museum: Spend the afternoon exploring the Calouste Gulbenkian Museum. This museum houses an impressive collection of art, including works by Rembrandt, Monet, and Picasso. Evening - Take a Walk Along the Avenida da Liberdade: Take a stroll along the Avenida da Liberdade, Lisbon’s main boulevard. Enjoy the impressive architecture and the lively atmosphere of this iconic street. End the day with dinner at the Taberna da Rua das Flores, a popular local restaurant. Day 4: Morning - Tour the Chiado District: Start the day off by exploring the Chiado district. Here, you can visit the National Theater of São Carlos, the Carmo Convent, and the Santa Justa Lift. Afternoon - Visit the Berardo Collection Museum: Spend the afternoon exploring the Berardo Collection Museum. This museum houses an impressive collection of modern and contemporary art. Evening - Take a Cruise on the Tagus River: Enjoy a cruise on the Tagus River in the evening. Take in the stunning views of the city from the river and admire the iconic landmarks of Lisbon, such as the Belém Tower and the 25 de Abril Bridge. End the day with dinner at the Solar do Castelo, a popular Portuguese restaurant. Day 5: Morning - Tour the Baixa District: Start the day off by exploring the Baixa district. Here, you can visit the Praça do Comércio, the Arco da Rua Augusta, and the Elevador de Santa Justa. Afternoon - Visit the National Tile Museum: Spend the afternoon exploring the National Tile Museum. This museum houses an impressive collection of tiles from the 16th to the 19th century. Evening - Take a Walk Along the Alfama District: Enjoy a stroll through the winding streets of the Alfama district. Take in the unique atmosphere of this historic neighborhood and admire the traditional architecture. End the day with dinner at the Taberna da Rua das Flores, a popular local restaurant. Day 6: Morning - Visit the Gulbenkian Garden: Start the day off by exploring the Gulbenkian Garden. Here, you can admire the lush gardens and take in the stunning views of the city. Afternoon - Take a Tour of the Sintra Mountains: Spend the afternoon exploring the Sintra Mountains. Take a tour of the historic castles and palaces of this region and admire the stunning views of the countryside. Evening - Take a Walk Along the Tagus River: Enjoy a stroll along the Tagus River in the evening. Take in the stunning views of the city from the river and admire the iconic landmarks of Lisbon, such as the Belém Tower and the 25 de Abril Bridge. End the day with dinner at the Solar dos Presuntos, a popular Portuguese restaurant.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by exploring the historical monuments in Tamil Nadu. Visit the Brihadeeswarar Temple in Thanjavur, the Shore Temple in Mahabalipuram, and the Nataraja Temple in Chidambaram. Afternoon: Head to the hill stations of Tamil Nadu and explore the beautiful Nilgiri Hills. Visit the famous Ooty Lake, the Doddabetta peak, and the Pykara Lake. Evening: Enjoy the vibrant nightlife of Chennai. Visit the Marina Beach, the Elliot's Beach, and the Besant Nagar Beach. End the day with dinner at Saravana Bhavan, a local restaurant famous for its South Indian cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Explore the wildlife of Tamil Nadu by visiting the Mudumalai National Park. Here you can spot tigers, elephants, and many other species of animals. Afternoon: Head to the beautiful city of Madurai and visit the world-famous Meenakshi Temple. Evening: Enjoy a boat ride on the Vaigai River and explore the many temples located on the banks of the river. End the day with dinner at A2B, a local restaurant famous for its delicious vegetarian dishes.

Day 1: Morning: Visit the Meenakshi Temple in Madurai. This temple is one of the most famous Hindu temples in India and is dedicated to the goddess Meenakshi. It is an architectural marvel, with its intricate carvings, colorful sculptures, and beautiful architecture. Afternoon: Take a boat ride in the backwaters of Kanyakumari. Explore the beauty of the majestic Indian Ocean, the lush green hills, and the stunning sunsets. Evening: Spend the evening at the beach in Chennai. Enjoy the cool breeze, the beautiful sunset, and the sound of the waves crashing against the shore. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant, Saravana Bhavan. Enjoy traditional South Indian dishes such as dosas, idlis, and vadas. Day 2: Morning: Visit the magnificent Brihadeeswarar Temple in Thanjavur. This temple is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is known for its grand architecture and sculptures. Afternoon: Take a trek to the top of the Palani Hills. Enjoy the stunning views of the surrounding hills and valleys, and take in the fresh air. Evening: Take a stroll through the streets of Pondicherry. Enjoy the French-style architecture, the quaint cafes, and the vibrant nightlife. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant, Auroville. Enjoy delicious French-style cuisine, including quiches, crepes, and ratatouille. Day 3: Morning: Visit the beautiful temples of Mahabalipuram. These temples are renowned for their intricate carvings, sculptures, and architecture. Afternoon: Take an elephant ride in the Mudumalai Wildlife Sanctuary. Enjoy the beautiful scenery of the dense forests and the exotic wildlife. Evening: Explore the city of Coimbatore. Enjoy the shopping, the nightlife, and the delicious local cuisine. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant, Annalakshmi. Enjoy traditional South Indian dishes such as sambar, rasam, and curries.

Day 1: Morning: Visit Chennai, the capital of Tamil Nadu, and explore its historical and cultural attractions. Visit the Kapaleeshwarar Temple, the Fort St. George, and the Marina Beach. Day 1: Chennai Chennai is the capital city of Tamil Nadu and is the perfect place to start your 5-day tour of the region. It is a bustling city that is home to some of the most iconic monuments in India, including the Kapaleeshwarar Temple, Fort St. George, and Marina Beach. During your time in Chennai, you can explore the city's rich culture and history, visit the many markets and enjoy the delicious local cuisine. End the day with a visit to the famous Saravana Bhavan for some delicious South Indian food. Morning: Visit the Kapaleeshwarar Temple and explore the intricate architecture. Afternoon: Take a stroll down Marina Beach and soak in the stunning views. Evening: Enjoy a boat ride on the Adyar River and watch the sun set. Day 2: Kanchipuram Kanchipuram is a historic city located about 75 km from Chennai. It is known for its ancient temples and is often referred to as the "City of Thousand Temples". During your visit to Kanchipuram, you can explore the temples and marvel at the intricate architecture. You can also visit the famous silk weavers and pick up some of the exquisite silk sarees that the city is famous for. End the day with a visit to the famous Annalakshmi restaurant for some delicious vegetarian dishes. Morning: Visit the Kailasanathar Temple and explore its beautiful sculptures. Afternoon: Visit the silk weavers and pick up some of the exquisite silk sarees. Evening: Visit the Varadharaja Perumal Temple and enjoy the stunning architecture. Day 3: Mahabalipuram Mahabalipuram is a small town located about 60 km from Chennai. This town is home to some of the most stunning monuments in India, including the Shore Temple, Arjuna's Penance, and the Five Rathas. During your visit to Mahabalipuram, you can explore the monuments and marvel at the beautiful carvings. You can also visit the nearby beaches and enjoy the stunning views. End the day with a visit to the famous Mamallapuram Restaurant for some delicious seafood dishes. Morning: Visit the Shore Temple and explore its intricate architecture. Afternoon: Take a stroll down the beaches and enjoy the stunning views. Evening: Visit the Five Rathas and marvel at the beautiful carvings. Day 4: Thanjavur Thanjavur is a city located about 350 km from Chennai. It is home to some of the most iconic monuments in India, including the Brihadeeswarar Temple, the Thanjavur Palace, and the Siva Ganga Garden. During your visit to Thanjavur, you can explore the monuments and marvel at the stunning architecture. You can also visit the nearby markets and pick up some of the exquisite handicrafts. End the day with a visit to the famous Annalakshmi restaurant for some delicious South Indian dishes. Morning: Visit the Brihadeeswarar Temple and explore its stunning architecture. Afternoon: Visit the nearby markets and pick up some of the exquisite handicrafts. Evening: Visit the Thanjavur Palace and explore its beautiful gardens. Day 5: Madurai Madurai is a city located about 500 km from Chennai. It is home to some of the most iconic monuments in India, including the Meenakshi Amman Temple, the Thirumalai Nayakar Mahal, and the Gandhi Museum. During your visit to Madurai, you can explore the monuments and marvel at the beautiful architecture. You can also visit the nearby markets and pick up some of the exquisite handicrafts. End the day with a visit to the famous Saravana Bhavan restaurant for some delicious South Indian dishes. Morning: Visit the Meenakshi Amman Temple and explore its stunning architecture. Afternoon: Visit the nearby markets and pick up some of the exquisite handicrafts. Evening: Visit the Thirumalai Nayakar Mahal and explore its beautiful gardens.

Day 1: Chennai (Capital of Tamil Nadu) Morning: Start your tour by visiting the famous Marina Beach. Stroll along the beach and enjoy the views of the Bay of Bengal. Afterward, visit the Government Museum, which houses a wide range of exhibits, including coins, sculptures, and paintings. Afternoon: Visit the Kapaleeshwarar Temple, a 7th-century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. You can also explore the nearby Fort St. George, the first British fort in India. Don’t forget to check out the National Art Gallery and the Government Museum. Evening: Take a boat ride through the Adyar River and enjoy the views of the nearby temples. End the day with dinner at the famous Saravana Bhavan, serving delicious south Indian cuisine. Day 2: Kanchipuram Morning: Visit the famous Ekambareswarar Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Afterward, explore the nearby Kailasanathar Temple, a 7th-century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the streets of Kanchipuram and visit the many silk weavers. You can also visit the Kamakshi Amman Temple, dedicated to Goddess Parvati. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Bharatanatyam dance performance at the Kanchi Kamakshi Temple. End the day with dinner at the Saravana Bhavan, serving delicious south Indian cuisine. Day 3: Mahabalipuram Morning: Visit the famous Shore Temple, a 7th-century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. You can also explore the nearby Five Rathas, a group of five monolithic temples. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the streets of Mahabalipuram and visit the many stone carvers. You can also visit the Arjuna’s Penance, a bas-relief depicting the story of Arjuna’s penance. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Bharatanatyam dance performance at the Mahabalipuram Dance Festival. End the day with dinner at the famous Annalakshmi, serving delicious south Indian cuisine. Day 4: Tanjore Morning: Visit the famous Brihadeeswarar Temple, a 11th-century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Afterward, explore the nearby Thanjavur Palace, a 16th-century palace. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the streets of Tanjore and visit the many art galleries. You can also visit the Saraswathi Mahal Library, which houses a wide range of ancient manuscripts. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Bharatanatyam dance performance at the Thanjavur Art Gallery. End the day with dinner at the famous Gokulam, serving delicious south Indian cuisine. Day 5: Madurai Morning: Visit the famous Meenakshi Amman Temple, a 17th-century temple dedicated to Goddess Parvati. Afterward, explore the nearby Thirumalai Nayak Palace, a 17th-century palace. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the streets of Madurai and visit the many temples. You can also visit the Thiruparankundram Temple, dedicated to Lord Murugan. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Bharatanatyam dance performance at the Meenakshi Amman Temple. End the day with dinner at the famous Hotel Saravana Bhavan, serving delicious south Indian cuisine. Day 6: Rameshwaram Morning: Visit the famous Ramanathaswamy Temple, a 12th-century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Afterward, explore the nearby Agnitheertham, a beach dedicated to Lord Rama. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the streets of Rameshwaram and visit the many temples. You can also visit the Dhanushkodi, a beach where Lord Rama is believed to have crossed the ocean. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Bharatanatyam dance performance at the Ramanathaswamy Temple. End the day with dinner at the famous Hotel Saravana Bhavan, serving delicious south Indian cuisine.

Day 1: Morning Start your day by visiting the beautiful Rock Garden of Chandigarh. This garden is a unique example of art and sculpture made from industrial and urban waste. It is a great place to explore the creativity of the local artisans. After that, head to the Sukhna Lake, a beautiful artificial lake located in the foothills of the Shivalik range. Enjoy the peaceful atmosphere and take a stroll around the lake. Day 1: Afternoon In the afternoon, visit the Capitol Complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This complex is home to three iconic buildings designed by the famous French architect Le Corbusier. Admire the architecture of the buildings and take some amazing pictures. After that, you can visit the Open Hand Monument, which is a symbol of peace and prosperity. Day 1: Evening Spend the evening at the Rose Garden, which is one of the largest rose gardens in Asia. Admire the beauty of the roses and take a peaceful walk in the garden. After that, head to the Sector 17 Market and explore the local shops and eateries. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant, Punjab Grill. Day 2: Morning Start your day by visiting the Government Museum and Art Gallery. This museum is home to a wide collection of art and artifacts from the region. After that, head to the International Dolls Museum, which is a great place to explore the culture and heritage of India. Day 2: Afternoon In the afternoon, visit the Garden of Fragrance and admire the beauty of the flowers. After that, you can explore the Zakir Hussain Rose Garden, which is home to over 1600 varieties of roses. Day 2: Evening Spend the evening at the Rock Garden and explore the unique sculptures and artworks. After that, you can explore the local cafes and restaurants in Sector 9. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant, The Yellow Chilli. Day 3: Morning Start your day by visiting the Leisure Valley, which is a great place to take a peaceful walk and enjoy the beauty of nature. After that, you can visit the Tower of Shadows, which is a unique structure designed by Le Corbusier. Day 3: Afternoon In the afternoon, visit the Garden of Silence and admire the beauty of the flora and fauna. After that, you can explore the local markets and shops in Sector 22. Day 3: Evening Spend the evening at the Terraced Garden and enjoy the beautiful views of the city. After that, you can explore the local eateries and restaurants in Sector 7. End the day with dinner at the popular restaurant, Bistro.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day in Vancouver with a visit to Stanley Park. This 1000-acre park is located on the edge of downtown Vancouver and is home to many popular attractions such as the Vancouver Aquarium, Totem Poles, and the Vancouver Seawall. Spend the morning exploring the park and taking in the stunning views of the city and the ocean. Afternoon: After exploring Stanley Park, head to Granville Island for lunch. This popular spot is home to a vibrant public market, unique shops, and a variety of restaurants. Spend the afternoon browsing the market, taking in the sights and sounds of the island, and enjoying lunch at one of the many eateries. Evening: For the evening, take a stroll along the picturesque seawall. This walkway runs along the edge of Stanley Park and offers stunning views of the city skyline, the ocean, and the mountains. After your walk, end the day with dinner at Joe Fortes Seafood & Chop House. This popular restaurant offers an extensive menu of seafood and steak dishes. Day 2: Morning: Spend the morning exploring the city’s Chinatown. This vibrant neighborhood is home to a variety of shops, restaurants, and attractions. Spend the morning browsing the markets, exploring the temples, and sampling some of the delicious cuisine. Afternoon: After exploring Chinatown, head to Gastown for lunch. This historic neighborhood is home to cobblestone streets, unique shops, and plenty of restaurants. Spend the afternoon browsing the shops, admiring the architecture, and enjoying lunch at one of the many eateries. Evening: For the evening, take a stroll along the waterfront. This walkway runs along the edge of the city and offers stunning views of the harbor, the mountains, and the city skyline. After your walk, end the day with dinner at The Flying Pig. This popular restaurant offers an extensive menu of farm-to-table dishes.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day with a visit to Vancouver's iconic Stanley Park. This 1000 acre park is home to some of the city's most beautiful scenery and attractions. Take a stroll along the seawall, explore the forest trails, and marvel at the totem poles. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring Granville Island. This vibrant area is home to a variety of shops, restaurants, and galleries. Take a walk around the public market, grab a bite to eat, and take a boat ride around False Creek. Evening: End the day with dinner at The Fish House in Stanley Park. Enjoy fresh seafood dishes with stunning views of the ocean. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Museum of Anthropology at the University of British Columbia. This museum is home to an impressive collection of First Nations artifacts and art. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring Chinatown. This vibrant area is home to a variety of shops, restaurants, and galleries. Take a stroll through the streets, grab a bite to eat, and explore the Chinese gardens. Evening: End the day with dinner at Bao Bei Chinese Brasserie. Enjoy modern takes on traditional Chinese dishes in a hip atmosphere. Day 3: Morning: Start your day with a visit to Grouse Mountain. This popular ski resort is home to a number of outdoor activities, including hiking, biking, and ziplining. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring Gastown. This historic area is home to a variety of shops, restaurants, and galleries. Take a stroll through the cobblestone streets, grab a bite to eat, and explore the steam clock. Evening: End the day with dinner at The Flying Pig. Enjoy modern Canadian cuisine in a cozy atmosphere.

Day 1: Morning: Start the day with a visit to Stanley Park, the largest urban park in North America. Enjoy the sights, sounds, and smells of the park, which includes a seawall, beaches, and trails. Afternoon: Take a stroll around Granville Island, located in False Creek, and explore the public market, boutiques, galleries, and theatres. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Vancouver Lookout, where you can get an amazing view of the city and the surrounding mountains. Day 1: Morning: Ujjain is an ancient city in the central Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. It is situated on the banks of the Kshipra River and is one of the seven sacred cities of the Hindus. Start your day with a visit to the Mahakaleshwar Temple, one of the twelve Jyotirlingas in India. This temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is a popular pilgrimage site. Afternoon: After lunch, explore the Ujjain Fort, which was built by the Scindias in the 18th century. This fort is located on the bank of the Kshipra River and is a great place to explore the city’s history. After this, visit the Bade Ganeshji Ka Mandir, a temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Chintaman Ganesh Temple, which is one of the oldest temples in Ujjain. This temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha and is believed to be over 2000 years old. After this, savour some delicious local food at the popular restaurant, Chotiwala. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Kal Bhairav Temple, which is dedicated to Lord Shiva. This temple is believed to be the oldest temple in Ujjain and is a popular pilgrimage site. After this, explore the Sandipani Ashram, which is believed to be the place where Lord Krishna and his brother Balarama spent their childhood. Afternoon: After lunch, visit the Harsiddhi Temple, which is dedicated to Goddess Annapurna. This temple is believed to be over 2000 years old and is a popular pilgrimage site. After this, explore the Ram Ghat, which is a famous bathing ghat on the banks of the Kshipra River. Evening: End the day with a visit to the Gopal Mandir, which is a temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. This temple is located in the heart of the city and is a popular pilgrimage site. After this, savour some delicious local food at the popular restaurant, Chotiwala.

Day 1: Morning: Nainital is a popular hill station in the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, India. It is situated at an altitude of 2,084 m (6,837 ft) and is set in a valley containing a pear-shaped lake, approximately two miles in circumference, and surrounded by mountains, of which the highest are Naina (2,615 m (8,579 ft)) on the north, Deopatha (2,438 m (7,999 ft)) on the west, and Ayarpatha (2,278 m (7,474 ft)) on the south. Tourists can start their day by taking a boat ride in the Naini Lake and enjoy the scenic beauty around. Afternoon: After the boat ride, tourists can visit the Nainital Zoo and spot some of the rare animals and birds like Himalayan Black Bear, Barking Deer, Leopard Cat, Monal and Cheer pheasant. After that, tourists can visit the Naina Devi Temple and take part in the puja and aarti. Evening: Tourists can visit the Mall Road and enjoy shopping in the local markets. Later, they can also visit the Cave Garden, where they can explore the caves and also get a glimpse of the snow-capped Himalayas. End the Day with: Tourists can end their day with a visit to the famous ‘Kilbury’ restaurant, where they can enjoy the local delicacies like Aloo ke parathe, Paneer Butter Masala, and Gucchi Pulao.

Day 1: Morning: Athens is one of the oldest cities in the world and is the birthplace of democracy. Start your day by visiting the Acropolis, the iconic hilltop citadel that overlooks the city. Here, you’ll find the ancient Parthenon temple, the Propylaea gateway and the Erechtheion temple, all of which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Afternoon: After exploring the Acropolis, take a stroll around the Plaka district, the oldest part of the city. Here, you can wander through the narrow streets, browse the local shops, visit the many historic sites and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere. Evening: For dinner, head to the Monastiraki district, which is filled with lively bars, restaurants and cafes. Enjoy some delicious Greek cuisine and don’t forget to try some of the local specialties such as souvlaki and Greek salad. End the day with a visit to “O Thanasis”, a popular taverna serving traditional Greek dishes. Day 2: Morning: Start your day by visiting the National Archaeological Museum, which houses some of the most important archaeological artifacts from Greece’s ancient past. Then, take a stroll through the picturesque streets of the Psirri district and enjoy some of the city’s best street art. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the vibrant Syntagma Square, the city’s main square. Here, you can visit the Parliament building, the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier and the National Garden. Evening: For dinner, head to “Taverna Tou Psiri” in the Psirri district. Here, you can enjoy some delicious Greek dishes such as moussaka and spanakopita. Day 4: Morning: Visit the Sri Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Take a guided tour around the temple complex and admire the intricate sculptures and colorful paintings. Afternoon: Visit the Azhagar Kovil, a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Explore the sprawling temple complex and admire the stunning architecture. Evening: Visit the Tirumalai Nayak Palace, a 17th century palace built in the Indo-Saracenic style. Explore the sprawling palace grounds and admire the stunning architecture. End the day with dinner at Saravanaa Bhavan, a local restaurant known for its delicious South Indian cuisine. Day 5: Morning: Visit the Thiruparankundram Murugan Temple, a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan. Take a guided tour around the temple complex and admire the intricate sculptures and colorful paintings. Afternoon: Visit the Pazhamudhir Solai Temple, a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan. Admire the intricate carvings and colorful paintings of the temple. Evening: Take a stroll along the banks of the Vaigai River and explore the nearby Gandhi Memorial Museum. End the day with dinner at Annapoorna, a local restaurant known for its delicious South Indian cuisine.

Day 1 Morning: Visit the CN Tower, the iconic landmark of Toronto. Standing 553.3 meters tall, it is the tallest tower in the Western Hemisphere. Tourists can enjoy the breathtaking views of the city from the LookOut and Glass Floor levels, or take part in the EdgeWalk, a thrilling outdoor walk around the circumference of the tower. Afternoon: Explore the waterfront of Toronto. Take a stroll along the boardwalk, visit the various museums and galleries, or take a ferry to the Toronto Islands. Here, you can enjoy the beautiful scenery, take part in various activities and explore the historic island neighbourhoods. Evening: Experience Toronto's vibrant nightlife. Check out the various bars, clubs, and lounges, or take in a show at one of the city's many theatres. End the Day With: Head to the St. Lawrence Market for a taste of some of the best local food. Sample the various offerings from the food vendors and enjoy a delicious dinner.

Day 1 - Morning: Start your day by visiting the famous Arthur’s Seat in Mahabaleshwar. Enjoy the breathtaking views of the valley and the majestic mountains. You can also explore the nearby attractions like Pratapgad Fort and Venna Lake. Day 1 - Afternoon: After lunch, head out to explore the other attractions of Mahabaleshwar like the Lingamala Falls, Tapola, Dhobi Waterfall, and Krishnabai Temple. Take a boat ride in Venna Lake and enjoy the beauty of the surrounding hills. Day 1 - Evening: End the day with a visit to the famous strawberry farms of Mahabaleshwar. Enjoy picking fresh strawberries and relish the taste of local delicacies like strawberry milkshake and strawberry jam. Day 2 - Morning: Start your day by visiting the Mahabaleshwar Temple. This temple is believed to be one of the oldest temples in India and is dedicated to Lord Shiva. After visiting the temple, enjoy a trek to the nearby hills and explore the natural beauty of the region. Day 2 - Afternoon: After lunch, head out to the nearby sites like the Elphinstone Point, Lodwick Point, and Wilson Point. Enjoy the breathtaking views of the surrounding valleys and the majestic mountains. Day 2 - Evening: End the day with a visit to the local market of Mahabaleshwar. Buy some souvenirs and enjoy the local delicacies like puran poli and vada pav. Day 3 - Morning: Start your day by visiting the famous Parsi Point. Enjoy the breathtaking views of the surrounding valleys and the majestic mountains. After that, head out to the nearby places like Needle Hole Point and Bombay Point. Day 3 - Afternoon: After lunch, explore the other attractions of Mahabaleshwar like the Chinaman’s Falls, the Elephant’s Head Point, and the Arthur’s Seat. Enjoy the natural beauty of the region and take some amazing photographs. Day 3 - Evening: End the day with a visit to the famous Mapro Garden. Enjoy the delicious strawberry shakes and relish the taste of local delicacies like strawberry jam and ice-creams.

Day 1 - Morning: Start your day by visiting the iconic Red Fort, an architectural marvel that is a symbol of the Mughal Empire’s power and grandeur. After exploring the fort, take a leisurely stroll through the bustling Chandni Chowk market. Here you can buy spices, sweets, and traditional Indian garments. Day 1 - Afternoon: Spend the afternoon at the Qutub Minar Complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Here you can explore the ruins of a number of ancient monuments, including the iconic Qutub Minar tower. Day 1 - Evening: End the day by exploring the India Gate, a memorial to Indian soldiers who died in World War I. Enjoy a leisurely stroll around the area, and enjoy the beautiful views of the city. End the day with dinner at Bukhara, a popular restaurant that serves traditional North Indian cuisine. Day 2 - Morning: Start your day by visiting the iconic Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in India. After exploring the mosque, take a leisurely stroll through the bustling streets of Old Delhi. Here you can experience the hustle and bustle of the city, and buy traditional Indian garments. Day 2 - Afternoon: Spend the afternoon at the Humayun's Tomb, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Here you can explore the ruins of a number of ancient monuments, including the iconic Humayun's Tomb. Day 2 - Evening: End the day by exploring the Lotus Temple, a Bahá'í House of Worship. Enjoy a leisurely stroll around the area, and enjoy the beautiful views of the city. End the day with dinner at Karim’s, a popular restaurant that serves traditional Mughlai cuisine. Day 3 - Morning: Start your day by visiting the iconic Akshardham Temple, a stunning Hindu temple complex. After exploring the temple, take a leisurely stroll through the gardens of Lodi Garden. Here you can relax and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. Day 3 - Afternoon: Spend the afternoon at the National Rail Museum, where you can explore the history of Indian railways. Here you can explore the ruins of a number of ancient monuments, including the iconic Rail Museum. Day 3 - Evening: End the day by exploring the Connaught Place, a bustling shopping and dining area. Enjoy a leisurely stroll around the area, and enjoy the beautiful views of the city. End the day with dinner at Chor Bizarre, a popular restaurant that serves traditional Kashmiri cuisine.

Day 1: Morning - Visit City Palace, one of the most popular tourist attractions in Udaipur. It is a complex of 11 palaces, courtyards and gardens. Afternoon - Take a boat ride on Lake Pichola, one of the most beautiful lakes in Udaipur. Enjoy the views of the city from the lake. Evening - Visit Bagore Ki Haveli, an 18th century palace with a museum and cultural performances. End the day with dinner at Ambrai Restaurant, located on the banks of Lake Pichola. Day 2: Morning - Visit the Jagdish Temple, a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Afternoon - Take a tour of the old city and explore its narrow streets, markets and temples. Evening - Enjoy a cultural performance at the Jag Mandir Palace. End the day with dinner at the rooftop restaurant, Fateh Prakash Palace. Day 3: Morning - Visit the Monsoon Palace, a hilltop palace overlooking Udaipur. Afternoon - Visit the Ahar Museum, which houses artifacts from the ancient city of Ahar. Evening - Enjoy a sunset boat ride on Lake Pichola. End the day with dinner at the rooftop restaurant, Ambience. Day 4: Morning - Visit the Saheliyon Ki Bari, a garden complex with fountains and marble elephants. Afternoon - Take a tour of the Udaipur Solar Observatory, one of the oldest observatories in India. Evening - Enjoy a cultural performance at the Eklingji Temple. End the day with dinner at the rooftop restaurant, The Lakeview Terrace. Day 5: Morning - Visit the Fateh Sagar Lake, a beautiful artificial lake with three islands. Afternoon - Take a tour of the Kumbhalgarh Fort, one of the largest forts in India. Evening - Enjoy a cultural performance at the Bagore Ki Haveli. End the day with dinner at the rooftop restaurant, The Udaipur Sky. Day 6: Morning - Visit the Gulab Bagh and Zoo, a large garden with a variety of plants and animals. Afternoon - Take a tour of the Jagmandir Island Palace, a royal palace on an island in Lake Pichola. Evening - Enjoy a cultural performance at the City Palace. End the day with dinner at the rooftop restaurant, The Garden Terrace.

Day 1: Morning Start the day with a visit to the majestic Shillong Peak. Located in the East Khasi Hills, it is the highest point in Meghalaya and offers breathtaking views of the city and its surroundings. After taking in the views, head to the nearby Elephant Falls, one of the most popular waterfalls in the state. Day 1: Afternoon Take a drive to the town of Mawlynnong, known as the cleanest village in Asia. Here, you can explore the local culture, interact with the friendly locals, and take a walk through the village's lush green forests. Day 1: Evening End the day with a visit to the Nohkalikai Falls. Located near Cherrapunjee, it is the tallest plunge waterfall in India and offers spectacular views of the surrounding countryside. Day 2: Morning Start the day with a visit to the Mawsmai Cave, located near Cherrapunjee. This cave is one of the longest and deepest in the region and offers a unique experience for visitors. Day 2: Afternoon Head to the Double Decker Living Root Bridge, located in the village of Nongriat. This bridge is made of two layers of intertwined roots and is a unique example of the local Khasi people's engineering skills. Day 2: Evening End the day with a visit to the Don Bosco Centre for Indigenous Cultures. This museum showcases the culture, history and traditions of the local tribes. Day 3: Morning Start the day with a visit to the Mawphlang Sacred Forest. This forest is home to many rare species of plants and animals and is considered sacred by the local Khasi people. Day 3: Afternoon Head to the Umiam Lake, located near Shillong. This lake is a popular tourist destination and offers a variety of activities such as boating, fishing and swimming. Day 3: Evening End the day with a visit to the popular local restaurant, The Local Kitchen. Here, you can enjoy traditional Khasi cuisine such as Jadoh, a popular rice dish, and Pumaloi, a spicy pork dish.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day with a visit to the famous Christ the Redeemer statue. Take the cable car up to the top of Corcovado Mountain and admire the stunning views of Rio de Janeiro. Afternoon: Explore the beaches of Rio de Janeiro. Take a stroll along Copacabana and Ipanema beaches, and soak up the sun and the lively atmosphere. Evening: Enjoy a night out in Lapa. This vibrant district is home to some of Rio’s best bars, restaurants and nightclubs. End the day with dinner at Porcão Rio's, a popular restaurant serving up a delicious selection of Brazilian barbeque. Day 2 Morning: Take a tour of the historic city center. Visit the iconic Selaron Steps, the Metropolitan Cathedral and the Municipal Theatre. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon in the beautiful Jardim Botanico. This botanical garden is home to a variety of plants and wildlife, as well as a beautiful lake. Evening: Enjoy the sunset from the top of Sugarloaf Mountain. Take the cable car up to the top and admire the stunning views of the city. End the day with dinner at Bar do Mineiro, a local restaurant serving up traditional Brazilian food. Day 3 Morning: Explore the streets of Santa Teresa. This charming neighborhood is home to a variety of cafes, boutiques and galleries. Afternoon: Take a trip to the Tijuca National Park. This lush rainforest is home to a variety of wildlife and stunning views of the city. Evening: Relax and enjoy a caipirinha at one of Rio’s beachside bars. End the day with dinner at Zuka, a popular restaurant serving up a delicious selection of Brazilian dishes.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by visiting the Malpe Beach, located in Udupi district of Karnataka. This beach is known for its serene beauty and is a popular spot for tourists. You can enjoy the sun, sand and the sea and also indulge in activities like boating, swimming, and fishing. Afternoon: After spending some time at the beach, head to the St. Mary's Island, a group of four small islands located near the beach. This island is known for its basalt rock formations, which were formed due to volcanic activity. You can also take a boat ride and enjoy the views of the island. Evening: Next, visit the Sri Krishna Temple, a renowned temple located in Udupi. This temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna and is known for its religious significance. You can also explore the nearby temples and get a glimpse of the culture and traditions of the region. End the day with: After exploring the temples, end your day with a delicious dinner at the famous Hotel Giri, a popular restaurant in Udupi. Here you can enjoy a variety of local dishes such as dosa, idli, sambhar and more.

Day 1: Morning: Gwalior is a historic city in Madhya Pradesh, India. It is located in the northern part of the state and is known for its majestic forts and monuments. Begin your tour of Gwalior with a visit to the Gwalior Fort. This fort is a symbol of the grandeur of the city and was built by Raja Man Singh Tomar in the 8th century. After exploring the fort, take a stroll through the old city to explore its many temples and monuments. Afternoon: After exploring the old city, head to the Jai Vilas Palace. This palace was built by Maharaja Jayaji Rao Scindia and is one of the most impressive structures in the city. After exploring the palace, visit the Tansen Tomb. This tomb is a tribute to the great musician Tansen and is a must-visit for music lovers. Evening: In the evening, visit the Sun Temple. This temple is dedicated to the Sun God and is one of the most popular tourist attractions in the city. After exploring the temple, head to the Ghaus Ali Shah Tomb. This tomb is an architectural marvel and is a must-visit for history buffs. End the day with a meal at the popular local restaurant, Utsav. This restaurant serves traditional Indian cuisine and is a great place to end your day. Day 2: Morning: Begin your day with a visit to the Gujari Mahal Archaeological Museum. This museum is home to a vast collection of artifacts and sculptures from the past. After exploring the museum, head to the Gopachal Parvat. This is a hilltop fort and is a great place to get a panoramic view of the city. Afternoon: After exploring the fort, visit the Sas Bahu Temples. These temples are a great example of the ancient art and architecture of India. After exploring the temples, visit the Teli Ka Mandir. This temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is a must-visit for devotees. Evening: In the evening, visit the Man Mandir Palace. This palace was built by Raja Mansingh Tomar and is one of the most impressive structures in the city. After exploring the palace, head to the Rajwada Palace. This palace is a great example of the grandeur of the city and is a must-visit for history buffs. End the day with a meal at the popular local restaurant, Biryani House. This restaurant serves delicious biryani and is a great place to end your day. Day 3: Morning: Begin your day with a visit to the Madhav National Park. This park is home to a variety of flora and fauna and is a great place to explore nature. After exploring the park, head to the Gurudwara Data Bandi Chor. This is a Sikh pilgrimage site and is a must-visit for devotees. Afternoon: After exploring the Gurudwara, visit the Gwalior Zoo. This zoo is home to a variety of animals and is a great place to explore wildlife. After exploring the zoo, visit the Jai Vilas Palace. This palace was built by Maharaja Jayaji Rao Scindia and is one of the most impressive structures in the city. Evening: In the evening, visit the Chhatris. These cenotaphs are a tribute to the Scindia dynasty and are a great example of the architecture of the city. After exploring the Chhatris, head to the Gwalior Trade Fair. This fair is held annually and is a great place to explore local culture and cuisine. End the day with a meal at the popular local restaurant, Chawla's. This restaurant serves delicious Punjabi cuisine and is a great place to end your day. Day 4: Morning: Begin your day with a visit to the Suraj Kund. This is a stepwell and is a great example of the architecture of the city. After exploring the stepwell, head to the Gwalior Museum. This museum is home to a vast collection of artifacts and sculptures from the past. Afternoon: After exploring the museum, visit the Jai Vilas Palace. This palace was built by Maharaja Jayaji Rao Scindia and is one of the most impressive structures in the city. After exploring the palace, visit the Tansen Tomb. This tomb is a tribute to the great musician Tansen and is a must-visit for music lovers. Evening: In the evening, visit the Sun Temple. This temple is dedicated to the Sun God and is one of the most popular tourist attractions in the city. After exploring the temple, head to the Ghaus Ali Shah Tomb. This tomb is an architectural marvel and is a must-visit for history buffs.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day with a visit to the majestic Pandavleni Caves, a 2000-year-old Buddhist site with intricate carvings and sculptures. Take a stroll through the ancient caves, and learn about the history and culture of the area. Afternoon: Head to the picturesque Sula Vineyards, one of India’s most renowned wineries. Take a tour of the vineyards and sample some of the delicious wines. Evening: Explore the vibrant markets of Nashik, such as the Mahatma Phule Market and the Ganesh Peth Market. Browse the stalls and soak up the lively atmosphere. End the day with dinner at the Chitale Bandhu Mithaiwale, a popular local restaurant known for its delicious sweets and savory snacks. Day 2 Morning: Begin your day with a visit to the Muktidham Temple, a stunning white marble temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Take in the beautiful architecture and admire the intricate carvings. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Godavari River, one of the most important rivers in India. Take a boat ride along the river, and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. Evening: Visit the Anjaneri Hills, a beautiful hill station located near Nashik. Take a peaceful walk through the hills and admire the stunning views. End the day with dinner at the Hotel Shreyas, a popular local restaurant known for its delicious North Indian cuisine.

Day 1 - Morning Kanyakumari is a coastal town in the southernmost tip of India and is the meeting point of the Indian Ocean, Arabian Sea and the Bay of Bengal. It is a popular tourist destination and offers a variety of activities for visitors. Start your day by visiting the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, a monument built in honour of Swami Vivekananda who meditated here in 1892. Then, visit the Thiruvalluvar Statue, a 133 feet tall statue dedicated to the famous Tamil poet and philosopher. After that, you can take a boat ride to the nearby Vivekananda Rock and enjoy the beautiful views of Kanyakumari. Day 1 - Afternoon In the afternoon, you can visit the Kumari Amman Temple, dedicated to the goddess Kanyakumari. You can also visit the Gandhi Memorial, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi. After that, you can explore the local markets and buy souvenirs. You can also visit the nearby beach and enjoy the views of the sunset. Day 1 - Evening End your day by visiting the local restaurants and enjoy the local cuisine. You can also visit the local pubs and bars to enjoy a drink. Day 2 - Morning Start your second day by visiting the nearby Vattakottai Fort, a historical fort built by the Travancore rulers in the 18th century. After that, you can visit the Mathur Aqueduct, a bridge built by the British in the 19th century. Then, you can visit the Padmanabhapuram Palace, a historical palace built in the 17th century. Day 2 - Afternoon In the afternoon, you can visit the Thirparappu Waterfalls, a beautiful waterfall located near Kanyakumari. After that, you can visit the nearby Suchindram Temple, a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. You can also explore the nearby beaches and enjoy the views of the sea. Day 2 - Evening End your day by visiting the popular restaurant, Kadal, which serves traditional Kerala cuisine. You can also visit the local food stalls and enjoy the local food.

Day 1: Morning: Kanyakumari is situated at the southernmost tip of India, where the Arabian Sea, the Indian Ocean, and the Bay of Bengal meet. It is a popular tourist destination known for its natural beauty and spiritual significance. Tourists can visit the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, built in memory of the spiritual leader, and the 133-ft-tall Thiruvalluvar Statue. Day 1: Morning: Start your day in Raipur by visiting the Mahant Ghasidas Memorial Museum. This museum is a treasure trove of artifacts from the region's past, and is a great place to learn about the history and culture of the area. After exploring the museum, take a stroll around the city and take in the sights and sounds of the bustling city. Afternoon: After lunch, head to Amarkantak, a picturesque hill station located in the state of Chhattisgarh. This is a great place to take in the beauty of nature and relax. Take a leisurely walk around the hill station and soak in the sights of the lush green hills. Evening: After a relaxing day, head to the Banjari Mata Temple, a popular pilgrimage site in Raipur. Here, you can pay homage to the goddess Banjari Mata and seek her blessings. After visiting the temple, head to the popular restaurant, Chhota Kashmir, to end the day with delicious local food. Day 2: Morning: Start your day by visiting the Mahamaya Temple, a popular pilgrimage site in Raipur. This temple is dedicated to the goddess Mahamaya and is a great place to seek her blessings. After visiting the temple, take a stroll around the city and explore the local markets. Afternoon: After lunch, head to the Nandanvan Zoo, a popular spot for wildlife enthusiasts. Here, you can take a leisurely walk around the zoo and observe the different species of animals. Day 1: Morning Start your day with a visit to the Ajanta Caves, a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra. There are 30 rock-cut Buddhist caves that were carved out of solid rock between the 2nd century BCE and 6th century CE. Explore the intricate sculptures, frescoes and paintings that adorn the walls and ceilings of the caves. Afternoon Head to the nearby Ellora Caves, another UNESCO World Heritage Site. These caves are even more impressive as they have 34 rock-cut Buddhist, Hindu and Jain monuments that were carved out of a single rock between the 5th and 10th centuries. Take a tour of the caves to admire the sculptures and paintings. Evening End the day with a visit to the Daulatabad Fort, a 14th-century fort located just 20 km from the Ajanta Caves. Explore the fort and learn about its rich history. Don't miss the chance to see the Chand Minar, a 12-storeyed tower built by the Sultan of Delhi. End the day with a delicious dinner at the local restaurant, Maharaja Palace.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by exploring the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. Here you can learn about the history of country music, explore the interactive exhibits, and listen to live performances. Afternoon: Spend your afternoon walking around Nashville’s downtown area, visiting the many shops, restaurants, and bars. Be sure to check out the iconic Ryman Auditorium, the historic home of the Grand Ole Opry. Evening: End the day with a dinner at the famous Loveless Cafe. Enjoy their famous fried chicken and biscuits, as well as their other classic Southern dishes. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Parthenon in Centennial Park. This full-scale replica of the original Parthenon in Athens is a great place to learn about ancient Greek culture and architecture. Afternoon: Spend your afternoon exploring the Music Row area of Nashville. Here you can visit the many recording studios and record labels that make Nashville the Music City. Evening: End the day with dinner at the Wildhorse Saloon. Enjoy a night of live music, line dancing, and some of the best barbecue in town. Day 3: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Tennessee State Capitol. Here you can learn about the history of the state and explore the beautiful grounds. Afternoon: Spend your afternoon exploring the many parks and green spaces of Nashville. Be sure to check out Radnor Lake and Shelby Park for some great hiking and nature exploration. Evening: End the day with dinner at the Puckett’s Grocery & Restaurant. Enjoy some classic Southern cooking and live music in a historic building.

Day 1 Morning: Start the day with a visit to the Padmanabhaswamy Temple, located in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram. This ancient temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is an architectural marvel. After exploring the temple, you can take a stroll down the nearby East Fort market for some shopping. Afternoon: In the afternoon, visit the Kanakakunnu Palace, which was once the residence of the erstwhile rulers of Travancore. The palace is now a popular venue for cultural events and art exhibitions. You can also visit the nearby Napier Museum, which houses a rich collection of ancient artifacts. Evening: End the day with a visit to the famous Kovalam Beach. Enjoy the breathtaking sunset from the beach and take a walk along the shore. Day 2 Morning: Start the day with a visit to the Sree Chithra Art Gallery, which houses a collection of traditional and modern paintings from all over the world. You can also visit the nearby Zoological Garden, which is home to a wide range of exotic animals and birds. Afternoon: In the afternoon, head to the nearby Ponmudi Hill Station, which is located at an altitude of around 1000 meters. Enjoy the breathtaking views of the Western Ghats and take a leisurely stroll in the lush green hills. Evening: End the day with a visit to the popular Kovalam Fish Market. Enjoy the fresh catch of the day and savor the delicious seafood delicacies.

Day 1 - Morning Start your day by visiting the iconic Souq Waqif, one of Doha’s oldest and most vibrant marketplaces. Walk through the narrow alleyways of the souq and explore the unique shops and stalls selling traditional souvenirs, spices, handicrafts, and traditional clothing. Day 1 - Afternoon Spend the afternoon exploring the Museum of Islamic Art. This world-class museum houses a vast collection of Islamic art and artifacts from around the world. Afterward, take a stroll along the Corniche, the waterfront promenade, and enjoy the stunning views of the city skyline. Afterward, take a trip to the Katara Cultural Village, a world-class cultural center with a variety of activities, events, and exhibitions. Day 2 - Afternoon Spend the afternoon exploring the Villaggio Mall, a unique Italian-inspired shopping mall with a wide range of shops and restaurants. Afterward, take a trip to the nearby Banana Island, a man-made island with stunning beaches and a variety of activities. Afterward, take a trip to the nearby Al Zubarah Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most important archaeological sites in the region. Day 3 - Afternoon Spend the afternoon exploring the Doha Corniche, a beautiful waterfront promenade with stunning views of the city skyline. Afterward, take a trip to the nearby Al Koot Fort, a historic fort with a unique blend of Islamic and European architecture. Day 3 - Evening End the day with dinner at Al Khayyam, a popular restaurant serving delicious traditional Qatari dishes.

Day 1: Morning: Start your day by visiting the Bhagsunag Temple, one of the most popular shrines in Dharamshala. This temple is situated at the foot of the Dhauladhar mountain range and is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Admire the beauty of the temple and its surroundings. Afternoon: Visit the Dalai Lama Temple Complex, the spiritual and cultural center of Dharamshala. Here you can learn about the Tibetan culture and religion. You can also attend the prayer ceremony conducted here. Evening: Take a stroll through the vibrant streets of Dharamshala and explore the local markets. Here you can buy souvenirs and handicrafts to take back home. End the day with a dinner at the local restaurant called Kalsang, which serves authentic Tibetan cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Start your day by visiting the Dal Lake, a popular tourist spot in Dharamshala. Enjoy the serene surroundings and take a boat ride on the lake. Afternoon: Visit the Kangra Art Museum, which showcases the art and culture of the Kangra Valley. Here you can admire the various artifacts, sculptures and paintings. Evening: Take a cable car ride to the Triund Hill and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Dhauladhar mountain range. Also, visit the nearby Jada Theertham and Gandhamadhana Parvatham, two of the most important pilgrimage sites of the region. Day 1: Morning: Visit the Tokyo Skytree, the world’s tallest tower, for a panoramic view of the city. You can also visit the nearby Asakusa district, a traditional area filled with temples, shrines, and souvenir shops. Afternoon: Take a stroll in the Imperial Palace East Gardens, which offer a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Then, head to the Akihabara district, known for its electronics stores, anime and manga shops, and maid cafes. Evening: Explore the Shibuya district, one of Tokyo’s trendiest neighborhoods. Here, you can find an array of restaurants, bars, and nightclubs. End the day with a visit to the famous Robot Restaurant, a unique and entertaining experience. Day 2: Morning: Visit the Tokyo National Museum, the oldest and largest museum in Japan. Here, you can explore the history and culture of Japan through its various artifacts and artwork. Afternoon: Take a trip to the Tokyo Tower, the second tallest tower in Japan, for a great view of the city. Then, head to the Meiji Shrine, a beautiful shrine dedicated to the deified spirits of Emperor Meiji and his wife, Empress Shoken. Evening: Spend the evening in the Ginza district, Tokyo’s most exclusive shopping area. Here, you can find high-end stores, restaurants, and cafes. Day 1 Morning: Rajahmundry is a beautiful city located on the banks of the Godavari River in the state of Andhra Pradesh. It is known for its rich cultural heritage and is an important pilgrimage site for Hindus. A tourist can start their day by visiting the famous Godavari Pushkaram Ghat, where devotees come to take a dip in the holy waters of the river. After that, they can visit the Sri Rajah Rajeswara Swamy Temple and take in the stunning architecture of the temple complex. Afternoon: After lunch, the tourist can explore the city’s many attractions such as the Kambalakonda Wildlife Sanctuary, the Kotilingala Ghat, and the Dowleswaram Barrage. They can also visit the Ethipothala Waterfalls and take a boat ride in the Godavari River. Evening: In the evening, the tourist can enjoy the vibrant nightlife of Rajahmundry by visiting the local pubs and bars. They can also take a stroll along the banks of the Godavari River and enjoy the beautiful sunset. End the day with: After a day of exploring the city, the tourist can end their day by visiting the famous local restaurant, Gokulam, which serves delicious South Indian cuisine.

Day 1 - Morning: Start your day by visiting the Ellora Caves, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most important archaeological sites in India. The Ellora Caves are a complex of 34 rock-cut cave monuments, representing Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain art and architecture from the 600-1000 CE period. Take your time to explore each cave and admire the intricate carvings and sculptures. Day 1 - Afternoon: In the afternoon, take a tour of the nearby Daulatabad Fort, which is also known as Devagiri. This fort was built in the 12th century and is one of the most impressive forts in India. It is said to be one of the most impregnable forts in the world. Take a guided tour of the fort and learn about its history and architecture. Day 1 - Evening: End the day with a visit to the nearby Ellora Bazaar, a bustling marketplace where you can find a variety of local handicrafts and souvenirs. Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere and pick up some souvenirs to take home. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, The Spice House, which serves delicious Indian cuisine. Day 2 - Morning: Start your morning with a visit to the nearby Ellora Waterfall, a beautiful spot where you can relax and enjoy the scenery. Take some time to explore the area and admire the natural beauty of the waterfall. Day 2 - Afternoon: In the afternoon, take a tour of the Ajanta Caves, another UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most important archaeological sites in India. The Ajanta Caves are a complex of 29 rock-cut cave monuments, representing Buddhist art and architecture from the 2nd century BCE to about 480 CE. Take your time to explore each cave and admire the intricate carvings and sculptures. Day 2 - Evening: End the day with a visit to the nearby Ellora Temple, a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Admire the intricate sculptures and architecture of the temple, and take some time to explore the area. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, The Spice House, which serves delicious Indian cuisine. Day 1 Morning: Start your day by exploring the ancient temples of Bhubaneswar. The city is known for its temples, each of which is a masterpiece of architecture and sculpture. Day 1 Morning: Giza is a city in Egypt, located on the west bank of the Nile River. It is home to the famous Giza Necropolis, which includes the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Great Sphinx, and the Valley Temple. Tourists can explore these ancient monuments and learn about the history of the area. Afternoon: In the afternoon, tourists can visit the Solar Boat Museum, which houses the remains of a 4,500-year-old funerary boat. They can also explore the Giza Plateau, which is home to the Great Sphinx, the Great Pyramid of Giza, and other ancient monuments. Evening: In the evening, tourists can take a felucca ride down the Nile River. They can also explore the Khan el-Khalili bazaar, which is one of the oldest and largest markets in the Middle East. End the Day With: End the day with a visit to the popular Abou Shakra restaurant, which serves traditional Egyptian cuisine.

Day 1: Morning Start off your day by exploring the Giza Necropolis, a complex of ancient burial sites including the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Pyramid of Khafre, and the Pyramid of Menkaure. Take a guided tour of the area, and learn about the fascinating history and legends associated with these ancient monuments. Afternoon After lunch, head over to the Great Sphinx of Giza, an iconic symbol of ancient Egypt. Take a guided tour to learn more about the sphinx's mysterious history and its unique features. Afterward, why not take a camel ride around the pyramids for a truly unique experience? Evening Spend the evening at the nearby Giza Zoo, home to a variety of exotic animals from around the world. Take a guided tour of the zoo and learn about the animals, and then take a relaxing stroll through the lush gardens. End the day with dinner at a local restaurant such as the popular El-Kahira Restaurant, which serves traditional Egyptian cuisine. Day 2: Morning Start your day at the Giza Solar Boat Museum, which houses the reconstructed ancient funerary boat of Pharaoh Khufu. Take a guided tour of the museum to learn more about the boat's fascinating history and its unique features. Afternoon Head over to the nearby Giza Plateau and take a guided tour of the area to learn more about its ancient history. Then, take a visit to the nearby Step Pyramid of Djoser, the oldest pyramid in Egypt. Evening Spend the evening at the Giza Sound and Light Show, a spectacular multimedia presentation that brings the ancient monuments to life. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Ali Baba, which serves delicious Egyptian dishes. Day 3: Morning Start your day at the Giza Pyramid Complex, which is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Pyramid of Khafre, and the Pyramid of Menkaure. Take a guided tour of the complex to learn more about the history and legends associated with these ancient monuments. Afternoon Head over to the nearby Saqqara Necropolis, a complex of ancient burial sites, and take a guided tour of the area to learn more about its fascinating history. Afterward, take a visit to the nearby Saqqara Step Pyramid, the oldest pyramid in Egypt. Evening Spend the evening at the nearby Cairo Tower, an iconic symbol of the city. Take a guided tour of the tower and enjoy the stunning views of the city from the top. End the day with dinner at a local restaurant such as the popular Al-Azhar Restaurant, which serves traditional Egyptian dishes.

Day 1: Morning Kausani is a beautiful hill station in Uttarakhand, India. It is known for its breathtaking views of the Himalayas, lush green forests and peaceful atmosphere. Start your day with a visit to the famous Anasakti Ashram, which was once the home of Mahatma Gandhi. Here, you can learn about Gandhi’s philosophy of truth and non-violence. After exploring the ashram, take a walk through the beautiful pine forests of Kausani. You can also visit the nearby tea gardens and enjoy the views of the majestic Himalayas. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, Deodar, which serves delicious local dishes. Day 2: Afternoon Continue your tour of Kausani with a visit to the Baijnath Temple, which is considered one of the oldest temples in India. Here, you can explore the intricate carvings and architecture of the temple. Afterwards, take a hike to the nearby Sumitranandan Pant Gallery, which showcases the works of the famous poet. In the evening, head to the Kausani Tea Estate and learn about the tea-making process. End the day with dinner at the local restaurant, Bhowali, which serves delicious local dishes. Day 3: Evening Spend the evening exploring the beautiful Kausani Lake. Here, you can enjoy a peaceful boat ride and take in the stunning views of the lake. Afterwards, visit the nearby Kausani Tea Museum and learn about the history of tea production in the area. Finally, end your day with dinner at the local restaurant, Kausani Cafe, which serves delicious local dishes.

Day 1 Morning: Ernakulam is a bustling city in the Indian state of Kerala. It is the commercial and financial hub of the state, and is known for its vibrant culture and lively atmosphere. As a tourist, you can start your morning by visiting the famous Hill Palace Museum. It is the largest archeological museum in Kerala, and houses a plethora of artifacts and historical items. After exploring the museum, you can take a leisurely stroll through the nearby Marine Drive, which offers stunning views of the city. Afternoon: In the afternoon, you can visit the Mattancherry Palace, also known as the Dutch Palace. This palace was built by the Portuguese in 1555, and is renowned for its beautiful murals and intricate carvings. You can also visit the nearby St. Francis Church, which is the oldest European-built church in India. Evening: In the evening, you can explore the bustling markets of Ernakulam, such as the Broadway Market and the Marine Drive Market. Here, you can find a variety of unique items, from antiques to traditional handicrafts. After a day of sightseeing, you can end the day with a delicious meal at the famous Hotel Saravana Bhavan, which serves some of the best South Indian cuisine in the city.

Day 1: Morning: Visit the Sacred Valley of the Incas. This beautiful valley is filled with Incan ruins, archaeological sites, and a stunning landscape of mountains, rivers, and terraced fields. Tourists can explore the ruins, hike, mountain bike, or take a horseback ride. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the city of Cusco. Take a tour of the city’s historic sites and museums, wander the cobblestone streets, and visit the local markets. Evening: Take a stroll through San Blas, a charming neighborhood filled with art galleries, boutiques, and cafes. End the day with dinner at Limo, a popular restaurant serving traditional Peruvian cuisine. Day 2: Morning: Take a drive to the nearby town of Pisac and explore the ruins and traditional markets. Tourists can also visit the nearby Incan terraces and hike to the top of the mountain for stunning views of the valley. Afternoon: Visit the nearby town of Ollantaytambo and explore its ancient ruins, cobblestone streets, and traditional markets. Evening: Take a train to the nearby town of Aguas Calientes and explore the town’s thermal baths. End the day with dinner at El Indio Feliz, a popular restaurant serving traditional Peruvian cuisine. Day 3: Morning: Take a bus to the ancient city of Machu Picchu and explore the ruins. Tourists can hike to the top of the mountain for stunning views of the surrounding landscape. Afternoon: Take a train back to Cusco and explore the city’s historic sites and museums. Evening: Take a stroll through the Plaza de Armas and explore the vibrant nightlife. End the day with dinner at Cicciolina, a popular restaurant serving traditional Peruvian cuisine.

Day 1 Morning: Haridwar is a major Hindu pilgrimage city in India. It is located in the foothills of the Himalayas on the banks of the River Ganges. Start your morning by visiting the famous Har Ki Pauri Ghat and take a dip in the holy waters of the Ganges. You can also take a boat ride to witness the beautiful sunrise and the mesmerizing view of the city. Afternoon: After lunch, visit the famous Chandi Devi Temple, a Hindu temple dedicated to goddess Chandi Devi. Evening: In the evening, you can visit the Bharat Mata Mandir, a temple dedicated to the mother India. You can also visit the Ganga Aarti at the Har Ki Pauri Ghat and witness the mesmerizing evening aarti. End the day with: After a long day of sightseeing, end your day with a delicious dinner at the popular local food joint, Bhola Ji Ka Dhaba. Enjoy the delicious local delicacies and end your day with a satisfied stomach.

Day 1: Morning: Alappuzha, also known as Alleppey, is a beautiful coastal town located in the south of Kerala. It is famous for its backwaters and houseboat cruises. Start your day with a boat ride through the backwaters of Alappuzha and take in the stunning views of the lush green vegetation and the tranquil waters. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the local markets of Alappuzha. From fresh fish and seafood to vibrant saris and traditional handicrafts, there is something for everyone here. Evening: Spend the evening visiting the Alappuzha beach where you can enjoy the sunset and take a leisurely stroll along the shore. End the day with dinner at the popular local seafood restaurant, Karimeen Restaurant. Day 2: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the Ambalapuzha Sri Krishna Temple, one of the most important temples in South India. Admire the intricate architecture and the beautiful sculptures of the temple. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary, located on the banks of the Vembanad Lake. It is home to a variety of birds and other wildlife. Evening: Enjoy a traditional Kerala performance at the Alappuzha Beach. This is a great way to experience the culture of the region. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Hotel Saravana Bhavan. Day 3: Morning: Spend the morning visiting the Marari Beach, located just north of Alappuzha. This beach is known for its pristine white sand and turquoise waters. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the Punnamada Lake, where you can take a boat ride and admire the stunning views of the lake. Evening: Spend the evening visiting the Mullakkal Temple, a Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Rajarajeswari. End the day with dinner at the popular local restaurant, Mango Tree.

Day 1 Morning: Start your day in Bali by exploring the beautiful temples and landmarks. Visit the iconic Tanah Lot temple and Uluwatu temple, both of which offer stunning views of the ocean. Day 1: MORNING: Start your day in Imphal by visiting the Kangla Fort, the ancient seat of Manipur's rulers. Explore the ruins of the fort, which is a reminder of the region's rich history and cultural heritage. AFTERNOON: After lunch, head to the Ima Keithel, an iconic local market run entirely by women. Here you can shop for traditional Manipuri items such as hand-woven shawls, jewellery and handicrafts. EVENING: End the day with a visit to the Shree Shree Govindajee Temple, one of the most important Hindu temples in Manipur. Here you can shop for a variety of items such as fruits, vegetables, spices, and local handicrafts. AFTERNOON: After lunch, head to the Manipur Zoological Garden, home to a variety of animals such as tigers, leopards and elephants. Spend the afternoon exploring the zoo and learning about the animals. EVENING: End the day with a visit to the Manipur State Museum, which houses a variety of artifacts and items related to Manipur's history and culture. After paying your respects, head to the nearby Loktak Lake, the largest freshwater lake in the region. AFTERNOON: After lunch, explore the nearby Keibul Lamjao National Park, home to the endangered Sangai deer. Spend the afternoon exploring the park and learning about the local wildlife. EVENING: End the day with a visit to the Kangla Sangai Festival, an annual festival that celebrates Manipur's culture and heritage. After exploring the festival, head to the nearby restaurant, The Red Chilli, for some delicious local cuisine. Spend the afternoon exploring the valley and learning about the local flora and fauna. EVENING: End the day with a visit to the Thangal Surung, a memorial dedicated to the 18th century Manipuri ruler, King Garib Niwaz. After exploring the memorial, head to the nearby restaurant, The Spice Kitchen, for some delicious local cuisine. After paying your respects, head to the nearby Sirohi National Park. AFTERNOON: After lunch, explore the nearby Sendra Island, a small island located in the middle of Loktak Lake. Day 1: Morning: Start your day by exploring the Valley of Flowers, a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in the Himalayas of Uttarakhand, India. This stunning valley is a paradise of natural beauty, with its lush meadows, vibrant wildflowers, and breathtaking views. Take a guided tour of the valley and learn about the diverse flora and fauna of the area. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon trekking the trails of the Valley of Flowers. Enjoy the stunning scenery and take in the fresh mountain air. Be sure to keep an eye out for the numerous rare species of birds, animals, and plants that call the valley home. Evening: End your day with a visit to the nearby village of Ghangaria. Here, you can sample some of the local cuisine and explore the culture of the area. Day 2: Morning: Begin your day with a visit to the nearby Hemkund Sahib, a revered Sikh pilgrimage site located at an altitude of 4329 m. The lake is surrounded by seven snow-capped peaks, and the views are simply stunning. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the nearby Nanda Devi National Park. This stunning park is home to a variety of rare species of plants and animals, and offers visitors the chance to experience the beauty of the Himalayas. Evening: End your day with a visit to the nearby Joshimath, a popular tourist destination. Here, you can explore the local markets, sample some of the local cuisine, and take in the stunning views of the surrounding mountains. Day 3: Morning: Start your day with a visit to the nearby Badrinath Temple, a revered Hindu pilgrimage site. This ancient temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is a popular destination for pilgrims. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the nearby Auli Ski Resort. This popular ski destination offers visitors the chance to enjoy the beauty of the Himalayas while skiing or snowboarding on the slopes. Evening: End your day with a visit to the nearby Mana Village. Here, you can sample some of the local cuisine and explore the culture of the area.

Day 1: Morning Start your day with a visit to the iconic Ramanathaswamy Temple, one of the holiest temples in India. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, this temple is one of the 12 Jyotirlingas. Explore the temple complex and admire the intricate stone carvings and sculptures. After your visit, take a stroll along the beach and soak in the beautiful views of the Bay of Bengal. Afternoon Take a boat ride to Dhanushkodi, a small fishing village located at the tip of Rameswaram Island. Admire the picturesque views of the sea and the famous Adam’s Bridge, a chain of limestone shoals connecting India and Sri Lanka. Evening Head to Pamban Bridge, a cantilever bridge that connects Rameswaram to the mainland. Enjoy the spectacular views of the sea and the bridge from the observation deck. End the day with dinner at Hotel Sea View, a popular restaurant known for its delicious seafood.

Day 1: Morning: Start your tour of Dublin with a visit to Trinity College, the oldest university in Ireland. Explore the stunning campus and marvel at the architecture of the Old Library and the Book of Kells. Afterward, take a stroll through the nearby St Stephen’s Green, a beautiful public park. Afterward, head to the National Gallery of Ireland for a look at the impressive collection of Irish and European art. Evening: Take a leisurely stroll along the River Liffey, admiring the views of the city from the Ha'penny Bridge. Then, head to the Temple Bar area for a night out. Enjoy some traditional Irish music in one of the pubs or grab dinner at one of the many restaurants. End the Day with: For dinner, try the traditional Irish dish of shepherd’s pie at The Church Bar & Restaurant. Day 2: Morning: Begin the day with a visit to the Dublin Castle. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon at the National Botanic Gardens, where you can explore the beautiful gardens and greenhouses. Afterward, take a stroll through the Phoenix Park, the largest enclosed park in Europe. Evening: Head to the vibrant South William Street area for some shopping and dinner. Then, take a stroll through Grafton Street, a popular shopping street lined with boutiques and cafes. End the Day with: For dinner, try the seafood chowder at The Winding Stair, a popular local restaurant.

Day 1 Morning: Trivandrum, the capital of the Indian state of Kerala, is a beautiful coastal city filled with cultural attractions. After that, you can explore the Napier Museum, a museum with a rich collection of traditional Kerala art and artifacts. Afternoon: Spend the afternoon exploring the city’s many attractions. Head to the Kuthiramalika Palace Museum, a former royal palace of the Travancore Royal Family, or take a stroll along the beach at Shanghumugham Beach. Evening: In the evening, you can enjoy a traditional Kathakali dance performance, a classical dance form of Kerala. After that, you can sample some of the local cuisine at one of Trivandrum’s many restaurants. End the day with a visit to the famous Punjabi Dhaba, a popular restaurant that serves delicious North Indian dishes. Day 1: Morning: Visit the Golden Temple, the spiritual and cultural center of the Sikh religion. Take in the beauty of the temple and its surroundings, and learn about the history and culture of the Sikh religion. Afternoon: Take a stroll through the bustling streets of Amritsar's Old City. Visit the Jallianwala Bagh, a memorial to the victims of the 1919 massacre. Evening: Visit the Wagah Border, the border crossing between India and Pakistan. Watch the daily flag-lowering ceremony and get a glimpse of the two countries' relationship. End the day with dinner at the popular Guru Ka Langar, a free community kitchen. Evening: Take a walk along the banks of the Ravi River and watch the sunset. End the day with dinner at the renowned Kesar da Dhaba, a local favorite. Evening: Take a tour of the Summer Palace of Maharaja Ranjit Singh. End the day with dinner at the popular Amritsari Kulcha House. Evening: Take a stroll through the bustling streets of Amritsar and explore the city's culture and heritage. End the day with dinner at the popular Bharawan Da Dhaba.
